review: Got a promotion coupon so stop here for dinner. Food was good but the prices compare to Cheesecake Factory are about the same but the portions are way smaller.  I would rather spend $$ at Cheesecake Factory than here. Pizza  prices are over price. Salads too. Wouldn't come back here just for pizza or salads.

My mom and I were eating here tonight and my fiancé came in halfway through dinner solely to just pick something up from me, he wasn't staying, so he stood at the edge of our table for less than 30 seconds. One of the male employees (not sure if he was the manager or not, but he was not our waiter) walks over to the table and was like "I'm going to have to ask you to leave, there's no soliciting" -- the employee didn't even ask if he knew us before making such an INSULTING and RUDE assumption. Taken back by the command, my fiancé asked him why he assumed he was soliciting and told him he was here with me (pointing). We never received an apology. The male employee retreated back to his pow-wow of other waiters and gossiped about what just occurred. No apologies whatsoever!  I never pull the race card, but yes my fiancé is black, and yes he was surely targeted! Never going back! Corporate will hear from us. I understand people make mistakes, but this was handled and approached so so poorly!

Decided to go here for dinner tonight since I had a gift card I got for graduation a year ago. Ordered the Waldorf chicken salad, Mac and cheese crisp, Thai chicken pizza and a Hawaiian pizza for my niece.  I thought everything we ordered was good but not as amazing as I thought it used to be. The salad had a nice amount of dressing and had candied walnuts, grapes, apples, Gorgonzola, and celery. The pizza was good, I just wished it came out a little bit hotter. The Mac and cheese crisp thing was not good, it had a funny taste and we had to take it back, so our kind server took it off our bill and apologized. Oh I forgot I did order dessert, the butter cake with ice cream and that was soft, buttery and warm. I enjoyed that since I've never had that before. Overall I think I would give this place 3.5 stars.

I've been here several times, with no issues. But tonight was just terrible. Our waiter took forever to take our order and when he did he was very unprofessional. When we got our food, not only was my pizza burnt badly on the bottom, but I couldn't even ask our waiter for a side of ranch because it took him 30 minutes to come over and ask us if we needed anything else and when he did, he said "I'm not doing anything so do you guys need anything else?". Just a terrible experience all around. Also worth noting, the restaurant was not busy. Will not be returning.

Went with my friends tonight and was totally shocked on how we where treated as PAYING! guest in the restaurant. Walk in didnt get greeted by a hostess had to wait about 5 to 10 minutes for someone to come over and to seat us. Get to our table and Emily was so slow! She took over 15 mins to take our order in that time we contemplated going somewhere else maybe we would had better treatment! My soup was horrible had no taste my friends pasta had way to much garlic in it and we will NEVER BE COMING BACK HERE AGAIN!! Maybe you guys need a trading day and get back on your A+ game!! Good luck  to your failing businesses  Ps bring back your normal items that you took off the menu!!!
Took my family her for lunch. I had the carne asada pizza it was delicious! Our waiter Danny was very attentive and made sure we had everything we need. What a great meal!

Went last night for a late night dinner and Emily, our server, was very professional. She didn't come to our table right away but apologized for it and never made us wait the rest of our meal. We appreciated her lovely personality and her attentiveness to our meal and refilling our waters and getting us out check and boxes to take home our uneaten pizza. She made sure my 5 cheese pizza came with pepperoni without any additional surcharges and my boyfriend's BBQ chicken pizza had plenty of chicken on it unlike the Burbank location we went last time. She made sure I got my points with the dough application and the appetizer WA sbrought first, before our meal, even though we ordered it first which I always stress about since some places forget to bring it out first but Emily made sure it came first and separately from our meal. We ordered the califlower BBQ appetizer which is always so amazing and tastes like chicken wings from heaven.  Thanks cpk for making our meal pleasant!

Disappointed in early lunch visit Friday. 3 tables occupied in the bar. Although we were seated first, we were last to get bread, which was dropped off (3 plates stacked) just before the meal. Mom's soup was just warm, but our waiter didn't check back with us to see how things were or fill my empty water glass. Check was delivered with no offer of dessert first. I hope he considers the meager tip may have been the lackluster service and not my cheapness!

We arrived at 1pm on a Sunday afternoon and asked for a table of 10. Note the restaurant was only around a third full. The hostess named Bri simply responded "no we don't have room for you" and upon asking for other alternatives, such as splitting our group in half, she said they couldn't do that either and we were more than welcome to go eat at a different restaurant. We are very disappointed in the rudeness and inability to accommodate customers who are even willing to be flexible and split up our party. We left and will likely not be coming back.

This CPK is never really packed. I've never had to wait too long to get a table. Parking is usually a little difficult since it's located in the Bella Terra plaza.  Service was okay. It took a little while to get out waters and bread.  Wild Mushroom Pizza: This is my favorite pizza here. I know there's no meat, but it's so delicious. I get it with the truffle oil. My boyfriend really liked this despite being a meat lover!  Garlic Cream Fettucine: good! Ordered this with mushroom as well. Brother finished this with no problem.  Garlic Chicken Pizza: this was good too. Comes with carmelized onions. Yummy.

Yvette is AMAZING!!!! Love CPK already but she made a Doordash wrong go right. And she didn't have to. I wish I could give her 10stars!!! Thank you Yvette for being so fabulous and making CPK shine!!!

My mind is blown right now. $7.00 for 5 small pieces of buffalo cauliflower appetizer!!!?? *see attached photo. CPK Fooled me once, with 2 egg rolls cut in half and calling 4 egg rolls but I forgave you... but this time, you have gone too far with up-charging for 5 TINY PIECES of cold mediocre cauliflower. Ladies and gentleman this is an example of big business treating their customers like a bunch of fools! I feel insulted. If you went down the street to Stonefire Grill you can order a WHOLE delicious grilled Cauliflower for $5.99! CPK-- You need to make this right!!!

I hardly eat here but when I do I usually get the tequila lime chicken pasta but I wasn't that hungry this time. I ordered the tortilla spring rolls which really were egg rolls. You get a sampler of any three flavors. There were three flavors to choose from: Mediterranean veggie, Thai chicken, and Baka chicken. I couldn't decide so I got one of each.  My favorite was the Thai chicken. The peanut sauce was very good, tasted like it could come from a Thai restaurant. My second would be the Baja but just because I like guacamole. My least liked would be the Mediterranean just because the cheese over powered all the veggies. It was also served with marinara sauce which is odd to me since I felt I should have been served with hummus or other sauce. It ended up tasting like a mozzarella cheese roll.  The reduced stars would mainly be from the service. It seems like waitress has forgotten about us. When it came time to get the check we waited for ten minutes with our empty plates just looking for her. The rolls are a good try though.

I do think CPK has stepped up their game a bit. Plenty of menu options besides just pizza, healthy offerings as well. I enjoy their soups and salads and even the salmon here was pretty good. Service was fine, food came out quickly. Portions are descent, but it is a bit pricey for chain restaurant food. Clean restaurant with plenty of seating, descent food but not worth going out of my way to return.

I hope Corporate or management reads this because NICO our waiter was beyond amazing. He thoroughly explained the menu to both my mother and I. He was very patient (because I had translate for my mom). I also requested a pizza with no onions and when i had ordered a soup, he explained that it was garnished with shallots and asked if I would like to have that topping omitted! NICO, YOU ROCK!!  I WILL DEFINITELY BE COMING BACK HERE!!  THANK YOU FOR YOUR FAMILY FRIENDLY AND EXTREMELY WELCOMING SERVICE!
It took 30 minutes to get our food and then the Thai crunch salads came out with no chicken.

My close mentor from church and I went for a hangout. He got a Dakota smashed pea and barley soup. It was good for the lunch duo with the grilled veggie sandwich and the Mediterranean salad. There was plenty of parking to find during noon. I wish they could clean the windows and other areas on a daily basis.

Honestly, I'm thankful that I got a $100 CPK gift card for Christmas to use because I wouldn't really spend that much of my own money to eat here personally.  First of all, I'm not a big fan of mainstream restaurant chains. CPK, BJ's, etc...they all are not that great in my opinion. Second of all, all the food is way overpriced. Like seriously, I know food ain't cheap these days but the prices on the CPK menus were crazy expensive. Third, it was predominately Caucasian. Asians don't really spend that much money on food actually. Cheap is the way to go.  Since I had a $100 gift card, we tried to spend close to $100 as much as possible. We ended ordering three pizzas, one pasta dish, two half salads, and two drinks. I don't recall the names of the pizza but I posted the pictures on Yelp. My favorite would have to be the thin crusted pizza...it ended up being one of the cheapest dishes actually. The most expensive pizza that we ordered was the $16 one but like it honestly tasted the most basic. you could easily get that from Costco for so much cheaper haha. The salad were pretty basic too. The pasta was good but the portion was not generous at all. Cries. In the end, we pretty much spent $100 flat including tax. Yeah I don't think I will be coming back...but it was a nice fee meal hehe. Just seem plain and basic in all.
Dry, hard pasta with barely any sauce. Absolutely despicable that they thought they can cheat me out on my order since it was a to go. Will definitely not be coming back

My daughter and I went here at an off time. It was pre dinner time, around 4pm. The restaursnt was not busy but appeared fully staffed for dinner shift. We were seated in the bar (my child is 6) when all others were seated in restaurant.  A total of 6 people passed us by, some more than once each: each without so much as an acknowledgement. Busser, Server, Host, another Hostess. Host/Hostess and another employee chatted at the front.  Manager passed by and Bartender saw us.  After waiting at least 15 minutes without put existence being acknowledged; we went to Islands and experienced exceptional service. This restaurant is example of what not do do in customer service. I am not a huge Islands fan. However, I am a fan of decent service and my kid likes Islands. Ill be sticking with Islands and their exceptional service delivery. Maybe CPK should go next door and learn a few things from Islands.

The last time I went to this California Pizza Kitchen, I ordered the shrimp lettuce wraps.  They arrived quickly and were totally delicious! Tip: Our server was really helpful and informative.  My friend had a number of questions about various menu items, and she answered all his questions throughly and professionally :-) Over and above the shrimp lettuce wraps, my friend and I shared the mahi mahi tacos, which were The Bomb! Bottom line: I LOVE CPK, and will return frequently :-)

I haven't eaten here in forever and now I remember why. I ordered take out from here last night for 2 people. I got their Hawaiian pizza, fire roasted veggie salad (added chicken) and an order of their split pea and barely soup and potato soup. The man on the phone said that each soup is good for 1 person. Before placing my order I checked their menu on there website via phone and nothing had prices next to it so when the guy said your total is $54 I was a little taken back but figured it would be a delicious meal.  The Hawaiian pizza I received was cold and average at best. When your restaurant has pizza in the name, you figure this would be the highlight of your meal, but nope. Any pizza from a local restaurant would have been better (Valentinos, Porkys, etc.). The salad was delicious, lots of veggies including artichoke hearts, avocado, corn, etc. The grilled chicken had a lot of flavor too but when I saw the price tag at 19.99. I was taken back. This is a pretty casual restaurant, even with the chicken added it shouldn't be more than $16. The soups were good but small portions....good enough for 1 bowl for 1 person and they were both priced at 7.99. Overpriced and not worth it for the small amount and quality.  The overpriced salad was the highlight of the meal lol. The pizza did absolutely nothing for us....little toppings, dry bland crust. You're better off getting pizza and salads at any local pizza joint for 1/2 the price... now I know for next time!

Decided to go here on a whim while driving down Edinger. The restaurant is located right off the 405 and Beach in the parking lot of Bella Tera.  Inside is clean and nice decor. Not a lot of people on a Tuesday night, which is never a bad thing (I hate crowded places). Some music but not too loud. Our server, Rafael, was polite and attentive. He always made sure we were taken care of.  The food came out pretty quickly. I ordered the Chicken Tequila Fettucine ($14.99) and thought it was a little bland and needed more sauce. My girlfriend ordered the Pesto Cream Penne with Chicken and Shrimp ($12.69 + $7.50) which was actually quite good despite the tiny chicken bone on her first bite.  The total was about $41 for the 2 dishes and a diet coke. The food quality and portion is about right for the price. I'd recommend to anyone that hasn't tried CPK yet.

I've always been a fan of CPK.  I think their pizzas are very good and they have an interesting variety of them.  Since I count calories I tend to go to chain restaurants more often these days since they have the nutrition guides available.  They're not as good as non-chain restaurants but I'm willing to sacrifice a bit for the convenience of knowing how many calories I"m consuming.  I try to eat fairly healthy but I want to enjoy myself too and nothing is more enjoyable in the culinary world than pizza.  I'll can enjoy a $25 pizza at Mozza's or a pizza hotpocket, I'm not picky.  I think CPK has really improved over the years.  The toppings are very high quality and they even offer Nueske bacon now which in my opinion is the best there is.  An entire pizza is about 1200 calories for majority of them which is high but since it's the weekend it's acceptable to me as long as I'm smart about the rest of the day.  The pizza's are large and very filling.  Donna is always trying to convince me to split a pizza and a salad but eff that... I want to consume a pizza not lettuce. I've been to Seal Beach, Long Beach, and this Huntington Beach location.  Even though foodwise they are all the same I think this location is the nicest inside with the most room.

The food is always good at CPK, we love the Thai crunch salad, the pizzas are very good & the key lime pie is heaven. Our server today was Derrick who was excellent, pleasant, fast, smile on his face & was a joy. Dear manager please know what a great employee you have the honor of working with you. Give him a raise, he sure deserves it!

I came with a large party of 20 people for our holiday get together.   I must say this has been the worst experience I've ever had.  We sat outside and they only had 1 girl waiting on our table.  While the waitress tried to do her best, the drinks were wrong, our orders took forever,  a single basket of bread was set on one of our 5 tables as we waited over an hour for any food.  When I went inside to see if there was anyone that could help our waitress there were 4 or 5 people just standing in front of the podium chatting with one another.  Not waiting or assisting anyone.  I will not be coming back here.  :-(

Used to love this place and go all the time. Like all the time. Then they got rid of my soup. Farmers market. I am a vegetarian and it was a vegetarian soup. It was amazing. They replaced it with tomato soup. Everyone has tomato soup. How boring and unoriginal. I haven't been back since they got rid of my soup. Thumbs down. But their service is good usually. Depends on time and who you get.

Staying at a hotel across the street, we decided to order some curbside pickup. I ordered a pizza and my wife, the shrimp scampi zucchini pasta. Curbside pickup about 5 minutes longer than the time given. The girl brings out the drinks and a large bag of food. Tells me to hang on while she waits on the pizza to finish. She brings the pizza and I leave. Get to the room. The first thing I pull out is a box with a small pizza in it. Next another small box with a pizza in it and finally the pasta. Wrong Pasta!!! Instead of Shrimp Scampi Zucchini, we think we ended up with Bolognese Spaghetti. Moving onto my pizza, remember the one I had to wait for, it was cold. In that long journey across the street, even catching the green light, it became cold some how. We work in the area a lot and finally found a good hotel we'll be returning to often, but sorry CPK, we won't be back to your place.

The food was good but the service was ok. What really made me mad was when I order my pasta with chicken the chicken was chewy and not good and almost made me vomit. I got multiple pieces of cartilage and was very disappointed.
The Buttercream Cake with a dollops of whip cream and Haagen Daz Vanilla ice cream is heaven and must be shared!

Just wanted to share some quick respond from the service and accomidations from our server and the manager Jose on Sunday night at our family dinner night. I had a moment where i was choking on some bread, the bread was great but i took a big bite of the bread and was choking but for the quick reaction from my family and nearby customers along with our server i am just fine. Jose the manager came over asap to make sure i was fine and made our stay complete. Also thanks to the assistant manager she  called the next day to check up on how i was doing. Now that is very professional and caring people here at CALIFORNIA PIZZA KITCHEN.  thanks again and highly recommend this place.

This particular location is always lacking in customer service. Last time I was here, I waited for my waitress for maybe 30 minutes before I finally went to go find someone else to help me, who just so happened to be the manager. Apparently the waitress was feeling ill and for some reason they did not let anyone else know that she had customers waiting. Ok? Now today, my waitress brings bread for the table right next to me, but so happened to forget mine. Do yourself a favor and head to fashion island (I usually never say that,) but that location always has excellent service. Bella Terra needs to get it's act together!

My coworker and I have been to this particular CPK at least 4 times in the last 6 months. Every single time they never fail to disappoint us with their lack of customer service skills.  It always takes at least 5 minutes to get seated , while all the servers just stare at you.  Once you finally get seated ( it's lunch I understand it's busy) it took another 7 minutes to get greeted by our server!

I only dined here because I had a gift card. If you want below average service, ok food, and your standard corporate restaurant experience then you'll get it here.  We wanted outdoor seating in the evening took which the hostess sat us at a table with no working light. We asked politely if we can be seated at the availableb larger table that had a working light, but was denied because of the potential for a larger group that preferred outdoor seating.  I can understand this if the restaurant was busy and the likelihood of such a party existing is possible but this wasn't the case. This is just poor customer service.

Awesome Service! Our family went to the location at Huntington Beach for lunch. We ordered three pizzas, and one of them was a Margherita. We wanted chicken on the Margherita, and our waitress Alejandra was happy to help us customize the pizza. When our orders arrived, we noticed that the Margherita didn't have any chicken on it; however, we didn't mind because the pizzas were good-sized portions. Our waitress Alejandra offered to give us extra chicken on the side, but we said that it was fine. After a few minutes, Laura (possibly the store manager) came to our table and asked us if we really were fine with the pizza, and offered to bake us another pizza for us. Still, we said that we were fine, and didn't need them to bake us another pizza. A couple minutes later, Laura came out with a fresh new pizza, saying that the chef had made us another pizza at no additional cost. She then said that she took the pizza off of our bill because it wasn't perfect the first time. We never asked for anything, much less for another free pizza, yet they went above and beyond to make sure that our visit to their pizza kitchen was absolutely amazing. We got 4 pizzas for the price of 2. The customer service really was fantastic, and we will definitely go back!

Another favorite restaurant of mine located in The Bella Terra shopping area.  You want to know what the secret food is here? The halibut! I've been to the other big , popular fish place within walking distance and was super disappointed three different times over the years with their halibut, comparing its size, taste and price, I said forget it. Then started my quest for a good halibut nearby.  And I found it at California Pizza Kitchen. Who knew.  Over the years I've had the salads which are very good, the pizzas, I like the roasted veggie, my bf likes the pepperoni with A side of fresh, chopped oregano.  I tried their seasonal menu. One item was root vegetables with chicken and it was so dry, so forget that. That was my only stay away from item.  They have good red wines, and I tried a mixed vodka drink that was made with three olives cherry vodka and sprite.. I don't know what it was called , but it was so good. I tried to copy it at home using 7-up and limes.  Lunch times have a special with a soup and side pizza which is a pretty good deal. Service is fast enough.  Also, I've come here twice on New Years Eve without any problem getting seating and the place was busy (2015 & 2016). Just remember it closes at 9pm.  All in all, lots of good choices and a fun place.
Clean establishment, friendly staff.  Among my favorite dishes here are the Thai Crunch Salad (with Thai peanut sauce only), Guacamole & Chips, Spinach Artichoke Dip and the Carne Asada pizza.

Interesting...  First impression was not a good one.   After being isolated from every other person in the restaurant,  we got to sit in the bar with our kids while employees sat around and chatted it up at the bar the entire time.

CPK with the parental units. This was post movie. Dunkirk, to be exact. I was in the mood for a salad and I was in the mood for a pizza. I didn't want a salad and a pizza. I also wanted a dry martini... although I don't drink anymore  (I promise, oh my Guardian Angel). Ok, Maybe I've earned one after the martini I had last week at Smokey Joe's . I've been hanging out with parents for a week.  It's been uh, interesting.  Anyway, CPK has a pizza which is half pizza, half salad.  Are you kidding me?  it was a pretty darn good pizza and sure enough, was topped by salad stuff. Greens and cheesy things.  By the way, the martini was so good, I spilled it. Our good server Andrew was kind enough to replace it.  Oh, and I spilled the first martini about half way through it's lifespan on the table. That seems to (and math is hard!) work out to one and a half martinis. I enjoyed the atmosphere, the menu, the drinks, and although I hesitate to even say this, my parents. I like to think that CPK had something to do with that. They've adopted Andrew the server too.

CPK is always a great choice for curbside pickup, especially on days like today when it's way too hot to cook and the humidity is driving one mad - what's up with that? Is this Florida?! Anyway CPK usually does not disappoint except the Bella Terra location no longer carries our fav appetizer - TORTILLA SPRING ROLLS, especially  BAJA CHICKEN ROLLS!!  Not ok Bella Terra CPK. Please bring those yummy rolls back or it's bye bye for us.

I really love the Kung Pao pasta here, it's super delicious!!!! Also the Bbq chicken pizza is super tasty. They have that one Strawberry Lemonade is kinda cool, my favorite so far. Deserts are little bit sweet but really good.
Came for veterans day with my wife.  Super great staff, yummy food.  and most of all, went above and beyond to make my family feel appreciated for our service.  thank you CPK!!!  Will come again.

The to go guy is so rude! My order was messed up and I called he basically made it seem like it was my fault since it was an online order and the writing was small..: well you read one part of that and got it right but not the other two things? I don't get tomatoes in my salad because I'm allergic! Therefore I had no dinner! It's pouring rain, thanks for your ability to not try and help! He didn't offer for a refund, or another salad... frankly I don't want one! The spinach dip we ordered was cold, not in the car on the way home cold, because we will in the apartments next to Bella's terra cold... but I was sitting in the window for too long cold! The chips are stale! I'm just so annoyed ... thanks CPK for nothing

I love CPK. But then again, I am also a sucker for pizza, so I'm not sure my review is exactly accurate. Their chipotle chicken pizza is on point. I like that you can have a combination of two different pizzas if you want as well. Their bread is also very delicious. Pricing is slightly more expensive than usual, so I wouldn't recommend going more than one every few months (unless of course you're rich and the rules don't apply to you).

Wait time on a regular Saturday evening (around 6pm) was 10 to 15 minutes. Luckily, we got seated in 5. We ordered the crispy macaroni and cheese. They came to us a room temperature.  I got the asparagus and spinach spaghettini. It was bland, so I doused 1/3 of the Cholula bottle in the dish. My boyfriend got the Thai Crunch salad (half-size). He thought it was okay. Service was not bad, just minimal. I commend the restaurant on their ability to have food delivered quickly. We were in and out of there in less than 1 hour. Seeing as to how busy they were, they do have a customer base that appreciates this. However, our experience was ... "ehh."

With all the pizza options now available CPK is not someplace that I'll go out of my way to eat at but that may change given my recent experience!  -  Great service - our waitress was very pleasant and didn't mind we were splitting one pizza and one salad among the 3 of us.   - Location - this is one of thew few areas at the Bella Terra shopping center that is not crowded.  Plenty of parking. - Food - the Waldorf Chicken salad was so tasty with walnuts, apples, and Gorgonzola cheese.  The veggie pizza was not as flavorful but the portion size was enough for us. My friends and I agreed this is our go to spot for our next lunch in this area.
Ordering online and picking up curbside was super fast and easy . Staff was super fast friendly and helpful. They made sure everything was correct and I had every I needed. Loved this service!

It's been a few years since my last visit to CPK. Still okay and good service.  Friday night at 6:30pm it was pretty crowded. We grabbed one of the high tables and soon after were able to switch to a roomy booth when one cleared up!  Started things off with the artichoke dip. It came out barely warm, loaded with cheese, and not enough artichoke. Not sure why it's a CPK recommended item.. Next came The Works pizza. Not too bad overall but at $13 it was not much better than a Mods pizza.  Service was definitely the saving grace for CPK. Excellent. Ambiance is great as well. Come for the atmosphere and service, not for the food.

This review is entirely for Kyle, our server. It has been YEARS since my fiance & I have had such an incredible server. He was prompt, kind, thoughtful, and professional. We had our 2 year old son with us who was starting to fuss a bit since he was hungry, and Kyle brought us some extra bread to tide him over until our food came. We received a free appetizer on the house that was absolutely delicious. Our food came out a moment after that and was hot and delicious! Kyle kept our drinks topped off the entire meal, and that is NOT an easy task with my fiance around! My fiance goes through 4-6 glasses of water plus another 1 or 2 of soda. Kyle even brought him a soda to go when we asked for the check!  You just don't find servers like this anymore... If you come to this restaurant, ask for Kyle! You won't be disappointed! Thanks for all of your great service, Kyle!

Came here for lunch on Easter Sunday and we were worried it was going to be packed due to the holiday. Surprisingly the restaurant was fairly dead when we walked in (as was the rest of Bella Terra, it seemed). Yet from that moment, the boyfriend and I were pleasantly surprised how quick the service was given how none of the staff could have been "in the zone" as the restaurant had been pretty empty for the last several hours as confirmed to us by our host who sat us immediately upon us walking through the door. Not a minute after being seated our waiter was very prompt at taking our drink order and getting us some complimentary bread and dip oil. He was very attentive throughout the entire meal with refills, more complimentary bread when he saw we were done with our first round, and later, boxes and the check. It was one of the smoothest restaurant service experiences I've had in recent memory. As for the food, everything was perfect. We started with the Club Avocado Rolls which were perfectly crispy and came with more than enough dipping sauce (don't you hate it when you get a tiny cup of sauce for an entire order?). For our entrees, I decided to try something other than my old standby, the classic BBQ Chicken Pizza, and ordered the Tequila Chicken Fettucine and my BF ordered his usual, the Jambalaya Fettucine. Oh my, I believe it's going to be hard coming back to California Pizza Kitchen to get pizza after I tried the Tequila Chicken Fettucine. The pasta was perfectly al dante and the sauce was magical. Definitely getting this next time. My BF's Jambalaya Fettucine was delicious and spicy like usual and he's glad to say that he's never been disappointed with his usual order, at least at this particular location (we can't say that's been the case at other CPKs we've been to). I'm glad we live close by since this CPK seems to be one of the most consistent chain restaurant locations in the area.

Great place for the kids . Friendly staff and foods great. I would have gave them 5 stars but the service is hit or miss. Some days they are on top of their game and some days they are doing other things and difficult to get a hold of . But 75% of the time we had good service

Had a great lunch today. My server Fredrico was attentive and knowledge about the menu and pricing and helped me chose the right items for me. I did get the BBQ Chicken pizza, after much pondering. It seems I can't stay away. It never disappoints. I ordered thin crust and took off the onions and cilantro . My stomach has other ideas about what I can eat but the pizza was great and Fredrico was great. It was a beautiful day and the patio was quiet. I couldn't ask for anything more. Another day in paradise.

The time was perfect for an early dinner.  It was around 4:45pm when we went inside this California Pizza Kitchen. No crowds to interfere with our early dinner.   We were seated right away and Jonathan came over to explain the menu and take our drink orders.  He then gave us time to decide.  My lovely wife ordered the pot stickers appetizers and they came piping hot with a sweet sour sauce dressing.  She thought the sauce was finger licking outstanding.  She ordered a Hawaiian pizza that came out really artistically good looking.  No complaints there.   I ordered a freshly cut wedge salad with crumbly blue cheese and bacon bits and with tomato squares.  A nice start of vegetables because I knew the pepperoni and sausage and mushroom pizza would be a standalone hearty meal by itself without any greens.  The mushrooms were cut thin and sweet to taste as well as the clumps of mild Italian sausage.  The pepperoni brought some salty spicyness to the pizza.   Iced tea was replenished and Jonathan kindly boxed any leftovers for us to take home.    A good dining experience all around and I would come back in the future.

Devoted CPK fans - Your crust has changed! If you used to order pizzas like the tostada pizza or white pizza, you may want to rethink things. CPK is now cutting corners and has gone cheaper with dough, but offers new crusts. The new dough is quite different and a bit off-putting. The tostada pizza is pretty much an actual americanized tostada, but with less toppings here. The chicken was skimped. It disgusted my boyfriend and they immediately explained the new dough to him. They then gave him a non-pizza item. I was okay with my white pizza with apple wood smoked bacon. The dough used is a bit chewier than usual, so you may have a bit of trial and error here. They handled things nicely though and our waitress was personable.
Just had lunch here. Waitress and manager were both really nice and attentive. Great food and service - will definitely be back!

It's been awhile since I have been here...  I came in on a Thursday around 2pm to have a late dinner with the girlfriend.  I was quite disappointed to find out that they did not offer happy hour ever =(.  Oh well... we started off with Hummus and Pita.  For myself, I got a half order of the BBQ Chicken Chopped Salad.  The hummus and pita was okay, nothing special.  As for my salad, I kinda wish I asked for dressing on the side because it was over drenched.  There was BBQ sauce as well as ranch.  The BBQ sauce was the perfect amount but the ranch was drenching my lettuce like no other.  It was still good though and enjoyable.  My girlfriend got the Fire-Roasted Chile Relleno.  I had a taste but she was right.  It was super spicy and kinda unbearable.  She said the last time she had it, it wasn't as spicy.  It was good though.  Both of our plates were fairly small and we finished everything  Our total was around $30 (with tip) for an appetizer and a small plate of food each.  Our service was pretty excellent.  Our server was friendly and helpful.  Our food came out pretty quick.  My only thought is that CPK needs to have happy hour if they want more people coming in.  It's always pretty empty every time I go.

The drinks here are great! I had a strawberry lime marguerita. The salmon dish is tasty, $18. Food presentation nice. We like the pizza here as well. Thin crust. You have a nice selection of pizzas and non pizza dishes.

Our server emily was great. And if i could rate service and food different i would. Food is very unwelming. So was sangria.  Whatever white mint bs that was its gross. Wish this was a better experience. The butter cake was good but dry a bit. Our sever Emily was wonderful. Cant wait to see her again. Her jokes an menu knowledge was the best!!!

Service is okay. I really like the food! Yeah it's chain restaurant food but hey it's yummy! I got the spinache artichoke dip for the 1st time and it was sooooo good. We usually get the chicken wraps too because they are so yummy. The mango lemonade is so good too! They have really fun non-alcoholic drink options too. I've been coming here for a long time and I've never had a bad experience.
Everything is good here. My favorite  is the bbq chopped salad. Get the full size so you can share or bring the other half home.

Ate here yesterday. Service was good, but the pizzas we ordered were just BAD. The crust was what ruined it. Not sure how they achieved this, but the crust was paper thin yet simultaneously had that school cafeteria cardboard texture. They also changed the menu for the worse, spaghetti bolognese is no longer on the menu. That aside, this cpk location is a miss.

I had eaten here several times before tonight, but never again.  I ordered a pepperoni pizza (original pepperoni only, not the extra-spicy kind) and added mushrooms.  I also requested  it a.little well-done so it wouldn't be soggy in the middle.  When the pizza arrived, it was in fact limp and soggy.  The waitperson offered to "put it back in for a minute or 2."  I got it back 10 min. later, burned black.  The waitperson apologized and said they'd remake it.  The remade pizza, which I did eat most of (didn't feel I could fuss at them any more), was  again greasy, limp and soggy.  Yuck.     I recommend staying away from this particular CPK until they get their act together, if that ever happens.

My Love likes to go to CPK, to get her "fix." I go because I love her. Mostly it's hit-or-miss with me. The avocado club egg rolls were a hit. The had a great flavor and came out piping hot. The Grilled ribeye steak was a miss. I thought ordering a steak was risky, but I thought they would treat a $26.99 steak with respect. Yeah, I was wrong. I asked for medium well. I got medium rare, well done l, and burnt, all in the same steak. Even some of the fingerling potatoes I got were undercooked. I ate around the burnt parts and was thankful for the egg rolls and bread. Our Server was nice and attentive... until they gave her a big party. I blame the Manager for the resulting bad service. A runner could have kept the drinks refilled. My Love finally had to walk to the bar to get a refill. I saw the Manager watch it happen - no apology or assistance was given (bad Manager). I gave tonight 3 stars for the egg rolls and the fact that the Fiancée loved her pizza. From now on, I'm going to stick with getting pizza at CPK. If it's in their name, then they have to do it right. Right?  Here's hoping!

I'm surprised by the less-than-stellar reviews. We LOVE this place! Their food is consistently excellent & reasonably priced, service is usually great, and we've catered many kids' birthday parties here. It's not Le Cirque, but neither are the prices, and it is EXCELLENT for what it is. Yes, parking can be tight, but that's a function of Bella Terra, not this restaurant. Its one of the best CPKs we've visited!

I love this place ! we get great service and really great food every time we go there .my wife and I usually split the thin crust Sicilian pizza and we'll also split a Caesar salad which I love the fresh sliced parmesan that they put on top of,  took my daughter out for her birthday there last night, and again as usual , food was splendid & service was excellent. this is a great place to go although sometimes you have a small wait of 10 to 15 minutes.

Solid place to eat, but I generally find that most chain restaurants aren't that amazing, to begin with. My aunt ordered us the Thai Crunch salad and avocado eggrolls for appetizers. The Thai Crunch salad was very Americanized (to be expected, frankly) so it wasn't that great. I did like the avocado eggrolls, unexpectedly. It had good flavor and textures, and I would order it again if I ever decide to come back to CPK. For pizzas, we ordered their seasonally inspired sunny-side up egg and potato pizza with bacon, The Works, and the garlic chicken. My favorite of the three was the garlic chicken. The Works was subpar and the egg pizza was slightly disappointing. I feel as if the toppings on the egg pizza could have been more evenly distributed. If you have a choice though, get your pizzas with thin crust! It is so much better than their regular crust. Finally, for dessert, we had the red velvet cake and the chocolate souffle cake. I liked both but they weren't extraordinary. Overall, you can count on CPK to not have offensive food. However, if you're going to spend $20ish per person, I think you're better off going to Korean BBQ or a smaller restaurant in Costa Mesa. The food scene in this part of OC is pretty good that going to CPK should be a last resort kind of deal. Like I said, CPK is solid but not worth it frankly. I will say though that the service is pretty good! Not as bad as most chain restaurants in this area.
2nd time we came here.  Sat down and no one came to our table to greet or service.  Walked to the front to tell hostess and see four employees just chatting it up.  Disappointed.

This review is for the cleanliness inside of the restaurant. My daughter wanted to go to cpk because it's our favorite place to go. When we walked inside and were seated at the tAble....to my surprise it was very sticky even the drinks menu was filled with something. The table was not throughly wipe down, under the table there were napkins and food pieces on the side. As a customer I loss my appetite just looking at it. There were pieces of wrapper or trash on the floor as when we walked inside. I would like to come back but if it's not that clean I would go somewhere else. Another complaint was I have my dough rewards and the waiter informed at the end of of our meal that there system was down. Not only I could not add my points from last night, I couldn't even use my points and the special event $10 off $40 purchase.

Decided to come here for lunch w family because 1) haven't been back in ages 2) my parents always chose Cheesecake Factory and I wanted something different  I have to say the menu has changed quit a bit since the last time I was in.  Items are relatively the same they just dropped a few things I liked. Decided to order the steak because it looked delicious on the menu.  We also ordered the lunch pizza (mushroom spinach) w Mediterranean salad and the Kung Pao spaghetti but with penne instead  (no meat because my moms vegetarian) The steak was cooked just right w butter on top (see pic) thought the sides were a bit wimpy for the price.  My dad liked the pizza and my mom's KP penne came with chicken...lol wow did I not mention that my mom is a vegetarian?!&@   Geez good thing my mom caught it before eating the chicken.  But it all worked out cuz the pasta she tasted was too salty and hard so instead she changed to pesto cream with fettuccine.  She said it was pretty good. Overall the food was good and the service was..hm...let's just leave it at "she didn't catch the chicken in a vegetarian's entree."  But I'm sure that's not going to deter my mom from tipping big or coming back :P
I loved to go to CPK. But I went there last night,the waitress was so rude. I never have had bad service before. I never come back CPK in HB.

If only I could give 100 stars!   We eat out a lot on our many travels.  It is so rare to find a waitress as good as Emily.  Professional - Sweet - Kind - Friendly - Helpful - Amazing!    She made us have a better vacation.  What a nice thing to do!  We are so thankful! The food was fresh.  All the other employees seemed to be having a good time.   If Emily is the measure for this restaurant, the management, and training.... then this place is solid GOLD.

I usually love going to cpk but I went last Wednesday 12/28 and our waitress was literally so rude she wouldnt give us kids menus and when she was giving us bread she dropped one and didnt even give us another one nor pick it up off of the ground ?? I was so offended. They also dont have fries on their menu which is annoying. Also we ordered water with lemon and she didnt put lemon in any of them. Stay away from this location or go to buffalo wild wings instead

I love California Pizza Kitchen. The overall experience is fantastic. Everyone is so welcoming. Especially the server Michaela, she is excellent. She had my drinks out in no time. She answered all my questions and her recommendation for food was spot on. She's absolutely fantastic. She's a very important asset to the company.

Great service tonight. There must have been a few big parties so we ended up waiting quite a bit of time for our food. We weren't in a rush so it was ok. The manager brought out our food, apologized and told us dinner was taken care of by them. Amazing service when we didn't even complain. More restaurants should be like this!! We will definitely be back!!

My Father and his wife, brought my Girlfriend and I here for a post holiday lunch.  Our waitress was great.  She  was polite, courteous, personable, and the food was wonderful.  In my  opinion, it is a great place to  catch a well prepared meal!

So tonight was a pleasure to come here. This is mostly for the service and some about the food. The food is great, pizza is always a good choice on a Friday night after a long week! But this review is strictly for our server Diana. She was so attentive & on point with checking up on my party. We ordered two pizzas, four cheese & tomato & a Sicilian thin crust as well as the California Cobb salad. Everything was great, & when I had asked Diana her recommendations regarding salad dressing and which sangria she enjoyed she provided us with solid choices. Not in the way where you feel she's trying to sell you but a genuine response that made me excited to try what she recommended. Serving is a challenging job at times especially on a Friday night. Diana handled it with grace and honestly one of the best experiences I've had in a long time while out to eat for dinner. Thank you Diana!

They know pizza. Although I think the secret is they add sugar to their crust, whatever they do it works! Happy to see a whole wheat crust option and flat bread option. I'm not a pizza person but I am dragged here with friends and family so this helps me have more options when it comes to ordering The chicken Ceaser salad pizza is still one of my favorites, very generous with the salad portion but the little pizza slice added goes a long way :-) Don't forget to ask for their bread basket at the beginning. They are freshly baked and delish! I know one is sourdough and the other is that deep-brown bread with just a hint of something sweet. Super tasty and it's nice to have something to nibble on as their pizzas take a little while to arrive. There are good lunch specials so it's a good lunch stop. This location in particular is close to work so I tend to go here for a quick lunch if I'm running short on time.
Food is amazing. Service is amazing. Ethan is the best server ever! I'll definitely come back soon with my family just because of him!

Jamaican jerk chicken pizza all day please  If you're looking for good, consistent quality pizza, this should be your go-to! My girlfriend may be sick of it since I make us go bi-weekly, but there's a reason why! Plus, the flavored iced teas are addictive!
Fantastic atmosphere 5 star service very clean food served fast and hot our waitress ( Danielle ) is the best

I'm going to start my 5 stars review with a Thank for the manager Eric and the staff . Every one ask us if every thing is good and they want to make sure every thing is ok. The manager Eric opened the door for us when we entered the store and during our dinner came by to check on us to make sure every thing is perfect. Like checking on friends when u have them for dinner. That's what u call good management , not sitting in the office playing solitaire . The server was great  Best of all the food is great u gotta try the grilled chicken in the kids meal.

Oh this was one of the best meals ever Even though they were busy with large parties the service we received was awesome. I have never had guacamole with corn and it was amazing. The Cobb salad was huge and tasty but I must say Andrew our waiter was fantastic. As was the manager ,Shae. I was very impressed with the whole meal and will definitely be raving about this location and revisiting in the future definitely a 5 star experience.

Pizza is something you can literally walk around the corner and find and be pretty satisfied with. What sets this place apart from the rest is their level of service, and friendly staff that makes people repeat customers. It's located inside the Bella Terra area so there's plenty of parking, they remodeled the place pretty recently so everything looks more modern and clean. Expect to be greeted immediately, they're very attentive here and if you don't believe me you'll see for yourself when you visit. Ask to sit in Andrew' section, he'll take care of you.  I feel like the first couple of moments when you meet your server set a precedence on how the rest of the meal goes. Andrew was easy to talk to and made sure we had everything we needed throughout the meal. Service was fast and Andrew was knowledgable on the menu whenever we had any questions. I'm still kind of upset that they got rid of the Sante Fe Pizza, but the spicy chipotle chicken is a pretty good alternative. Good amount of heat, and they don't skimp on the meat. Mushroom sausage is a close second too. Again, the biggest difference between good and GREAT servers are the ability to make a connection with your guests and make them want to come back for more. I'll definitely be revisiting!

One Of Our LONGTIME FAVORITE RESTAURANTS!! Can't go wrong at CPK. From my Early Days at 'Store #1' on Beverly Drive in Beverly Hills & The Beverly Centre Store..This CHICKEN TEQUILA FETTUCCINI!! Has had A Hold On Lots of Us! Along with the ORIGINAL,,Often Copied BBQ CHICKEN PIZZA..Chopped Italian Salad!! Sometimes, I just Gotta Have em!!  So, now in OC...We Love the Edinger Edition..Just GREAT..."Johnny On The Spot" took Excellent Care of Our Bit Fussy Group (Dad and his Pals) 'Extra Everything'  was NO PROBLEM For our Waiter "JOHN"..He actually Made the Evening..Great Smile, Winning Attitude. We ate our way thru the Delectable Choices. From Appetizers to Salads, Pizza, Pasta...We left Very Happy with EVERYTHING..THAT Doesn't happen Often..Bravo to this OC..CPK..AND STAFF!! WE SHALL RETURN!!!

When I need my pizza fix, they're always a good choice. This particular experience could have been better due to the drink service being less than adequate. We went on Friday dinner time so he was busy. I understood but overall it was quite tasty and for the price, I keep coming back.

CPK is consistently delicious. The ambiance is classy but casual, and the servers are always attentive. They give you some fresh bread and olive oil with spices to start out. My favorite item is the Mushroom Pepperoni Sausage hand tossed pizza. The crust is crispy and never soggy, and they are generous with the cheese and toppings. It always has a great flavor. The small portion of the Caesar Salad is actually on the larger size! You could split it if you want a true small portion. There is a little something for everyone on the menu and I do enjoy coming here from time to time when I want a guaranteed tasty meal.

Service was good. Fast bartender  Lounge music playing.  Tortilla soup was just right, ordered a cup & it filled me up.  Had spring rolls-mediterrean veggie & Thai chicken , came with Thai peanut & sun-dried tomato sauce. Red trolley ale reminded me of a new castle , a little bit bitter. Overall good experience, just stopped in for a quick snack after shopping at REI.

So many hipsters these days with attitudes like: OMG, I can't stand chain restaurants.  Yadda, yadda, yadda.  You know who you are, but you still eat at Taco Bell and Del Taco.  Yeah dude, those are chain restaurants too.  And said chain restaurants survive because they're consistent and their corporate owners know they have to change up the menu every now and then to keep up with the fickle American eater.   I honestly havent been to CPK in years.  Literally.  Like two years.  No real reason why I haven't been, just been there/done that but I ended up back here on Friday night because I wanted some consistent good food.  Had the usual BBQ chicken salad, but friends got the Tequila Lime Chicken Pasta and Pesto Chicken Sundried Tomato Pasta and both were delicious.  Would definitely recommend trying the Tequila Lime Chicken Pasta.  Service was great. Not sure how long it's been on the menu, but keep it around and I'll keep coming back.   Other that than, yes this CPK is in Bella Terra which has now grown into a shopping/dining/apartment living destination so traffic gets crazy and parking is difficult, but it's still better than finding a place to park in LA.  ;)

After the half marathon at Disney early this morning, my body is sore but I saved my tummy for this CPK AND IM IN Cali!? We ordered pizza and more pizza, oh and we even got a free appetizer! I love eating here My life is great now that I have this in front of me !

4 stars because the silver was dirty both times it was served to us but the reason I placed it higher than a 2 was because the place is very calm and really nicely styled. The pizza I had was kinda blah (but I can't expect a lot being gluten and dairy free) but my bf said he loved his Bbq chicken pizza and the server was really nice ask for her when you come in her name is Thienhuong! And my bf said that he loved his butter cake with vanilla ice cream he said it was absolutely amazing!

Do not Order takeout. I repeat. Do Not. I ordered red velvet cake, pasta, and pizza. The pasta barely had sauce and the whipped creme on the red velvet cake melted. The pizza was tough. Next time~ Little Caesars for all.

Super great service...food was good. I was between 2 pizzas (I always get the same thing but felt adventurous) glad I mentioned it to the waiter because he offered to do 1/2 and 1/2! What? Sounds crazy but I've been eating at this restaurant on and off for 15 years and I never knew u could do that! Was so happy I did! I loved the Thai Chicken Pizza! The other 1/2 was the BBQ Chicken Pizza...my normal. Anyway...great service..restaurant was clean...bartender was super nice and came up to our table offering a new sour beer and let us taste it...overall really good experience!

Server I wish I had her name but she catered to my party with the most and realest host that a waitress could do.  Food was cool especially when you hungry. I enjoyed that they wasn't stingy on the cheese.  Negative point is that you paying for personal pizzas at $12-16 a pie. 3 stars only cause of the service 1 star for the food tasting the way it should when fresh. 5th star missing due to the price.  You can go to Blaze or Pie-ol-ogy get any amount of toppings for $8. But go to Blaze lol ever since pieology went franchise they pizza quality went down and taste so weak and blah like cheap dough.  Sorry CPK but I always never liked your prices and only went here due to my friends choosing it. Even in the early 2000s I hated your prices. Pricey for a small pizza when $16 I can get more quality and quantity. I wish you well and hope you know 4/5 stars is the truth and not being bias on my experience. It was the service that saved your prices from being 2/5 stars.

Nothing special about theyre bbq pizza. I had it with bacon(add-on) and pineapple (add-on). Our server was very attentive and kept refilling my Sprite. I usually go to islands, for their endless tortilla soup, but im tired of their horrible service and gave cpk a try. Theyre mac and cheese small plate, nothing fancy. Didnt like it actually...

My husband and I took our grandson and we attended the tip a cop fundraiser tonight to benefit the Special Olympics. What I was so very, very impressed with was the staff members of the CPK working with the special Olympians and how kind and loving and supportive they were. We had a young man who was a special Olympian, and he was somewhat struggling and the CPK employee was so kind and so patient and so loving with him. As was the Huntington Beach police officer who was their wing man. We had an amazing time, and we were so proud to to  teach our grandson to have respect and love for our special Olympic heroes, but also our heroes in blue. And the staff at this location is fabulous. And I would like to give a special shout out to my amazing friend Bryan Baker for letting me know about this amazing evening so my family and I could be a part of it. It was truly a privilege and an honor for us to be there this evening.

Service was excellent, place was clean, but the pizza was just okay. I gave four stars because we enjoyed the overall experience and I may be overly picky about the pizza. I was very surprised at how slow they were on a Friday evening, but happy we didn't have to wait to eat. Overall a nice place to eat.

***** Been here, done that ***** I've been to this California pizza kitchen a few times and wasn't really that impressed. Yes, they make little thin fancy looking pizzas, but it's not enough to win me over. Sure, you can call my taste buds bland, but I can go with a Costco pizza any day.  I went here usually because someone in the group suggests going here. Unfortunately this is one of those places I'd go for the atmosphere and service. The food is only secondary.  Food = so so Seating area = clean  Service = excellent  Restroom = clean  Parking  = congested
Really friendly staff and awesome food! We keep coming back here even though we live closer to the one in Garden Walk.

Enjoying dinner before the Huntington Beach Band POPS Concert Saturday evening at Bella Terra Promenade. The Thai and Barbecue Chicken pizzas are delicious! Thank you California Pizza Kitchen for donating 20% of our check to HBHS Oiler Music Program. Go Oilers!

Came here twice on my recent trip home to HB. June 28, 2012- Garlic Fettuccine with mushrooms and broccolini- DELCIOUS!  I hate eating a heavy pasta dish without any greens and was glad our server recommended the broccolini.  We also had their chicken dumplings, which was just okay and I didn't like their sauce.  Service was good. July 8, 2012- Kung Pao Spaghetti?  Just no.  No no no no no.  It was extremely greasy, not enough sauce and just wasn't good.  I ordered it because I was curious and it had a little palm tree icon next to it.  Terrible!  Service was great though.  Our waitress was really nice and patient. I always come to this location since it's right down the street from my mom's.  Parking can get hectic considering its located in Bella Terra.

This CPK location is probably one of the best. Others I've been to in Orange County have either been very disappointing in service, had poor food quality and  were an overall blah experience. The Bella Terra location, seems to please and is inviting enough to come back again. Service is super. Dining area is clean and roomy. New pizza creations to try, also a deal for two during the week. New Sangrias to try which I must mention the Appleberry Sangria is mmmm delicious! A++ for liquor. Add that with half a Waldorf Salad and Thai Chicken Pizza and Im in CPK heaven.  Quick Thought:  What ever happened to the Jamaican Jerk Chicken Pizza?? It was soooooooo goood!! Please reconsider bringing it back CPK!  - that's all. thanks. Perks: Great wine selection. Cocktails and appetizers are decent and likable. Also the Small Plates rock if you aren't feeling gluttonous and are a nice price. This CPK is prime locale for shopping, movies and local entertainment. Love it! Overall: I cannot complain. Very sweet for a full meal on a budget and in a local area. Good times!

First off, we made reservations at 6:30pm and we did not get seated until about 7:00pm.  Bad start already.  We had a party of 13 people so yes, we ordered lots of food and everything was pretty good.  The corn guacamole starter plate was bland but overall, everything was quite good.  The only reason why I am giving this place two stars is because how they handled a certain situation.  Our server was bringing out drinks (luckily it was just water) and as she was bringing it to our table, she spills her tray and it ended up on my grandpa's lap.  His pants were soaked and it got my grandmas purse wet and the water + ice was just all over the floor.  Yes they cleaned it up and everything was okay I guess.  But I would hate to be the person sitting through a 2 hour dinner with wet pants.  If I was running a restaurant, and something like this happened, I would totally apologize (which they did), and take some sort of discount off the bill as to show how sorry they were.  They are not losing much since we had a huge party.  That was my only gripe about that and how they handled that situation.  That's it.

Great service we had diner day before easter.  The Chinese chicken salad is my favorite.  We tried a new pizza blt so good.  Really enjoyed or diner out way to go cpk.  Lizz is very attentive and super nice.  Made our experience that much nicer.

Let's face it; we all love pizza, right?  Well, this place is no Pizza Hut or Domino's; in fact, this even blows Pizza Hut, Domino's, even Papa John's out of the water (and I ORDER from Papa J's!).  I mean, who has ever heard of Peking Duck Pizza??  Obviously no one.   The first couple of times I went to CPK, I normally didn't order their pizzas; I ordered their Jambalaya on whole wheat penne, and boy, was it SPIIICYYY (in a good way, of course :P).  The sausage was not dry, and the crawfish was tender to my liking.  Now, onto the pizzas, which CPK was (and is) famous for. A couple of nights ago, I had ordered the Habanero Carnitas, and I'll tell you one thing:  If you don't like your carnitas spicy, LEAVE THE SALSA BE (the habanero salsa came on the side) unless you want to have your tongue burned.  Ahem...anyway, the carnitas were tender, and the vegetation (onions, spinach [pesto], etc.) was perfect.  And to the fact that I rarely to almost never consume the pizza crust, this crust was actually pretty good.  Not too chewy, and not too soggy either. Yes, I [will] miss CPK's Jambalaya for a while, but hey, if they're known for their pizzas, then I'll take their word for it. :)

A kind gesture by my family to save me the drive, a meet up at California Pizza in Huntington Beach, has become a lifelong treasury of wonderful memories. Beautiful memories of meeting, eating and laughing over a delicious array of the foods that are served while my beautiful nieces, handsome nephew and lovely sister share their stories and pictures.  Each time I visit I am reminded of the lovely times I have spent with them. The staff doesn't ever rush us as we talk about everything and anything and allows us to just sit in a comfortable setting as we enjoy a wonderful talk in a wonderful, and now treasured, restaurant.

This location really has terrific staff and management.   My friend booked a birthday party for 10am ( I didn't know CPK does this and it's very cool!)  and all the kids got to enjoy the restaurant,  make personal pizzas and enjoy the cookies and brownies that were served.   The parents got to enjoy it with coffee!  =)   Nice touch!    The kids got a tour of the kitchen,  a chance to speak with the head chef and all the staff was wonderful to the kids.   The kids got to see their creations put into the brick oven and the server brought them to the table when ready.   The parents enjoyed larger pizzas made by the chef and a very nice salad to go with it.   The Birthday party was a huge success and so much better than the ones I have held at Boomer's or a Bouncy house.  This is original, fun and a really good time.   The staff and the manager was outstanding in terms of customer service and making sure everyone was happy.  I love coming here anyway and had no idea they offered birthday parties for kids.  I will book this event for my kids next year.  It was 5 Stars fun and so easy on the parents compared to holding it at the average birthday places around town.  As a side note,  I really enjoy the pizza's when I come here and the salads are awesome!   I've always had great experiences dining at this location.  5 big Yelp Stars!

So I came into CPK on a Sunday night along with some family. We were greeted & seated right away from the employees who were very friendly and kind. The staff were very attentive and helpful with everything. We were served our drinks immediately and then were asked if we were ready to order. We got our drinks which were strawberry & mango and just a plain strawberry lemonade yet the flavor was very bitter and more sour than usual, very sour... After asking if we could get more sugar on the side, they offered to remake our drinks and were super kind about it. We just asked for sugar packs instead just so we wouldn't give them a hard time. After adjusting the drinks with the sugar, the flavor was much sweeter but it just wasn't the same as the usual house strawberry lemonade. As much as we didn't want to give them a hard time, we asked politely if we could just substitute or change our drinks. We ordered mango and strawberry ice teas and the drink was made perfectly this time around. Food wise we had ordered the chicken tequila fettucine, half bbq chicken and half pepperoni whole pizza, and a chicken Cobb salad. The food was great and we had no problems at all. To end the night, our bill was anonymously paid for! We were really in for a treat! So thankful for that kind deed! We will be coming back!
It was very frustrating trying to eat slices of pizza that were extremely thin and soggy!!! Horrible experience as we were expecting to have quality pizza. Pizza Hut would have been better.

Dined with my family last night and it wasn't busy, got seated quickly, service was decent. But the food took over 20 minutes and with 2 young kids, that was hard. Then after the food came, the chicken nuggets on the kids menu were really tough and the pizza I ordered was sauggy and wet, not sure but it wasn't a good experience food wise. And then we ordered the butter cake and usually it's really soft and good, but it was hard. They had a company party later that evening so I wonder if it was just not a priority to focus on food.

Food is the standard CPK food, you can't screw it up. The service is pretty terrible. We were introduced to our waiter by him carrying an empty tray and dumping whatever liquid was on it onto the floor. After taking our drink order, he spilled water on our friend, said sorry then didn't clean it up or bring extra napkins. Hey, oh! That's some terrible Ron Burgundy obliviousness. What a moron. My restaurant pet peeve is having to ask for more water. He nailed it. A waiter should come by and check on his patrons. When a restaurant isn't too crowded, this should be the norm. When it's busy, I understand. Our waiter wasn't swamped, rather he just underperformed. He didn't get a good tip.

We've been here twice in two weeks during the dinner hour and were immediately seated. Service is excellent and very prompt.  The menu has expanded greatly over the years with tasty, healthy choices.  Though I enjoy pizza, it's a huge carb load. I appreciate the other offerings they have, especially the chopped salads. So yummy. Since having moved back to this area recently,  CPK is quickly becoming a favorite again after a many year absence.  I used to work down the block from one in NorCal, and stopped going because the food was kind of bland and the service was hit or miss.  And then there was the hipster crowd. Go find your kale fix somewhere else. Thankfully,  there were very few present while we were enjoying our dinner.  It may be a chain restaurant,  but it's a cut above most. I'm looking forward to exploring the menu in the future.

Highly unfortunate choices by a corporate restaurant. They are in the middle of a major renovation and the place is a mess. Construction dust everywhere, very limited wine list, debris on the patio. It would be better if cpk closed for the major chunk of the remodel and reopen when they're on the finishing end. But NOOOO hungry corporate cpk is keeping this location open to make a few bucks and not meet any level of expectations.  Their wine list is being re-done so all they have is white zin and the 13.99 glasses. No customer recovery happening at all. Don't eat here until the remodel is done.....

The mini chicken quesadilla and Hawaiian pizza were bomb diggity!  I also ordered the frozen strawberry lemonade which was just as awesome as the food!  After gorging on food, what better thing to do than to head over to Barnes and Nobles? There was no line, service was exceptional, and you can even pay your bill at the table on the interacvtive touch screen menu thing they have now! Great for dates, large groups, or even a quick lunch with coworkers. Be sure to try out their White Pizza too! Cheese...and spinich. Yum. Definitely not authentic as Valentinos (in DC), but still worth the money!

Jeremy, the manager, and his team were amazing! I used their catering service for an event, and everything was perfect! They were super accommodating to all my special request. Very reliable and great service. We will definitely use them again for future catering needs.
The quality of food has really gone downhill.  Look what I was served.  It's supposed to be fish tacos, not slaw with dried up fish leftover parts!

Everything was great when I went. From the Server, the food, the time in waiting for the food, etc. Ordered the usual Chicken Tequila pasta, a friend got the BBQ chicken pizza. They were both delicious! Order came out fast, hot and fresh. Appetizer bread with the sauce was addicting. Server was really friendly and came by pretty often to check on us. Nice location, Nice environment! Has tons of shops you can browse through next to it to help you settle some of that good food down. This will be the first place I go to when craving pasta and pizza also a good drink. Please don't ever change! You guys are doing great!
This place is BOMBBBBB. Honestly the food here is so thick and good. But the waiters here are a bunch of pencils who obviously havent got their gooch swucked yet

Warn veggie salad with artichoke and shrimp is delicious.  Also love pesto pasta with shrimp and BBQ chicken pizza.  Can get $100 gift cards for $79 at Costco.  Ash for David who is best bartender / server

I had the greatest service ever from Kyle!!! He is my actual bae I will come back to CPK just for him! Also the manager Erik is super sweet and came to check up on us daily even though it was crowded and let us take pictures of them!!!

So I called to place an order that my husband was going to pick it up and he told me that they told him that they just had 2 items  and they didn't got 2 of my items so I called back to ask and they kept transferring me to different people and the last one was a guy and he hung the phone on me and I called again and this time was a girl and she hung  up on me too. I just think that's horrible customer service at least tell me sorry or something. I just don't recommend calling to place an order.

I come to this location often and have had both good and bad experiences. Last night I came in with my children to get a quick dinner before our movie. We were seated by what appeared to be the manager on duty (not bad on the eyes) and he was super sweet. Our server, Bret, was very sweet as well and was great with my two young children. Also not bad on the eyes. Food was great and attentive staff. No complaints about this visit. Would be 5 stars but i have to factor in past experiences.

I can't say I'm a big fan of this place. I've only eaten here twice and it was eh. I didn't pay either times so I guess that's okay haha. BUT the restaurant itself is outstanding. The place is elegant but casual. The noise level is very low. The service is the best I've ever had. I was very pleased to have come here with my brother. I had a great time :)

Will lie to your face about seating availability.  Don't they know once you get in you can see that they are big fat LIARS.  Bathrooms out of toilet paper. So what does the staff do in the event of not having toilet paper....hmmm

It was my first time, came for a birthday dinner... and was greeted by PHIL (excellent first impression & awesome, warm attitude). We were a little complicated with reservation and scrambled to add a few more people and an extra table.... no attitude or questions, they grabbed chairs and we're VERY accommodating. Again, impressive!  Then, apart from the awesome phil, we had our server... ROXY! Extremely helpful & patient with our huge party. With it being my first time, I was uncertain of what to order (apart from pizza) & I didn't end up liking the pasta dish. She offered to bring a new dish of my choice without additional charge... I passed & she gave me soup -on the house. She was very personable with our party & never seemed in a hurry or rush to get to other things. Excellent service here!!  Didn't give 5 stars because I didn't care for the dish too much. It was plain & small portioned.

CPK is a classic American chain that will have options for most people. Their pizzas and salads are the best options when you come here, while the rest of the menu is generally just ok.  The pizza's have recently changed recipe because the chain has decided to go more "artisan." With this the pizza crust has changed a little, they have more toppings then they use to, and the toppings are not as evenly placed or as evenly cut as they used to be. Personally I preferred the old style much better, but the new style still has a good taste to it.
I've been here many time I  find the service 5 stars  and the food are really good!  The moroccan salad wow Amazing the The garlic roasted chicken was fabulous Definitely coming back

I want to start off by saying how amazing our waitress was! She was so attentive and that's really important to me when I go out to eat! I think her name was Alison? Anyways she was awesome! So sweet! We sat outside, the patio area is very lovely and relaxing. Really enjoyed coming here, and the food is excellent. I ordered the margarita pizza (order this, and thank me later!) and my mom ordered I think the bbq chicken salad, we were both extremely satisfied. Worth every penny! I will certainly be back! Highly recommend if your in the area!

This CPK has recently been remodeled and seems to be under new management. It looks great and the new manager (or owner?) is really attentive! They've also stepped up their game with the French bread and herbed oil. (It's so good!) We get the BBQ salad and cheese pizza which makes for a delicious combo. The service is always excellent.
First time here and it was wonderful. We had a simple question about an ingredient in our food and we had, not 1 but 3 people coming to ask if everything was ok. Great service!

Been here quite a few times and thought it'd be good to write a review about this place. Great service, great food.....oh and you have to try their strawberry ice tea! Blammo!!! I mean yum!!! Haha   Love the white corn guacamole and chips.....oh and their mahi mahi tacos are quite tasticle if you are not craving the normal pizza concoctions.  The pizzas are good mind you but it's nice to try different stuff once in awhile right? The drinks are pretty durn tasty too.....nothing bad to say about this place honestly....come here and have a good time! Chomp!

Tried something different this time and glad we did! Opting from the traditional tasty pizzas. We tried some of their newer items: - Fried Mac n Cheese: It was okay, nothing special - White Corn Nachos: Simple, pretty good and not heavy - Jambalaya Pasta: Amazing! If you like spices with all the fixin's (Chicken, Sausage, Shrimp etc...) this is a must order! - Adventurous Wine Flight & White Wine Flight: The Moscato was a lil sweet for my palate. The Reisling was refreshing, the others went well with our meal. - AND they finally got rid of that complimentary spongy wonder bread and now they give fresh, warm sourdough bread with olive oil dipping (Nice change up CPK!) Overall, customer service was great, no complaints. And I do like how they have taken a fancier approach/look to CPK! Can never go wrong with CPK!

Great place! We love everyone that works here, wonderful atmosphere and always a good experience. Eric, the manager is the best. Such a kind and caring personality. If I could give them 6 stars I would! Keep it up guys. ;)
Did curb side pick up it was fast and easy and the girl was really nice. My meal was exactly what I ordered and delicious.

Im going to sit outside more often! Between the fires and the heaters, its so comfortable and secluded. Sort of nice for an early vday celebration. Had the pear gorgonzola with chicken chunks, spot on! House cabernet savignon, delicious. Hawaiian bbq pizza with added bacon, delicious with sam adams. (originally from 2/13/2013)

Great service!  Our waitress was attentive and very friendly!  The food was fantastic!  Get the BUTTER CAKE.  One negative thing we experienced while sitting outside in the patio area to eat, every so often we would get a strong smell of animal poop.  So sit inside.  Haha.

I have only good things to say about CPK super corporate but REALLY good. The pizza is Artisan and pretty fast but its delicious. I am not really Complaining the quality did not go down hill like some casual dining chains. Chillis,  Applebess,  On the Border. This place has kept quality at the top. The creativity just works and its pretty awesome.  The crust is awesome.

I went here w/ 4 coworkers including our boss from out of town. This was a terrible dining experience. The bread was stale and we each asked the server ( I remember his name clearly, but will not post his name) for utensils and bread plates which came after our lunches were served. Each time he'd say yes I'm getting them.   I did not go by choice, and I've never been a fan of this CPK or any CPK for this matter. I went w/ an open mind, but once again was disappointed.
We stopped by here for lunch and we had a BBQ pizza. So good! Our waiter was awesome and the restaurant was clean. Will definitely come back.

Hadn't been to CPK in a while, but I've always been a big fan of their pizza. I went to this location the other day for lunch and discovered a lot of newer menu items since last time I had CPK!  I was impressed with their "New Adventures" menu which included a quinoa and arugula salad and a yummy-looking chile relleno. I ended up going with the caramelized peach salad (half size with grilled chicken). It was the perfect light lunch and very reasonably priced.  The service was fast and friendly. I will definitely be back to this location

I come a few times a month and I have to say the food is always great and the service is amazing both dine-in and take out.  I had a misunderstanding with my take out order about 2 weeks ago but Brian the manager was able to resolve it with ease. They really do take care of you here. I would recommend this place to anyone. Thank you CPK staff !!! My husband and I love this place and will continue coming
