LOVE LOVE LOVE coming here right before the crowd comes in on friday nights. Pizzas are great. Faves: Thai Chicken, Spicy Chipotle Chicken, BBQ Chicken. I think i have tried them all! We tried some of the small cravings items this particular time: spicy quesadillas and white corn guac with chips, both were exceptionally amazing!  Service here is great. Jonathan is the best server ever. We have had him twice and he's super great and makes sure we are well taken care of. Easy on the eyes too.  Totally recommend this place after all.. I did have a bad experience once, but that can now be overlooked.

This place is solid. The pizza is delicious and tastes different than your average pizza parlor. The staff is very friendly and the pizza comes pretty quick. The price isn't too bad either..you'll pay around $20 for a large pizza that will feed 2 large men. There is also a great selection of pizzas to choose from. Being a meat lover I prefer the italian sausage, salami, canadian bacon, pepperoni  and capicola ham. Not much else to say about this place but if you are around Bella Terra or surrounding area it's definitely worth a try. and you definitely have to try  chocolate cake and/or tiramisu or BOTH.

Let me give a shout out to the new Four Seasons Pizza!!! The best pizza they serve!!!! Delicate thin crust, artichoke hearts, salame, onions, and ooey gooey mozarella!!! Then I gotta give some love to the fabulous Butter Cake!! The one and only - melts in your mouth!!! And you better get the ice cream on top! It's a mash up of cake/cheesecake/and a molten lava texture!!! Oh the CARBS!!! Food aside, here's where the fun starts! The have this awsome kiosk at every table which allows you to order apetizers, drinks, and desserts. IT GETS BETTER......you can page your waitress, divide your check, pay for your meal, and it even prints or emails you your receipt!!! How COOL is that????? CPK HB - you are an innovator!!! I will be back! You made my lunch not only tasty, but quick and convenient. What more can I ever ask for??? :)

We took the kids here to have dinner with the extended family.   It was pretty chilly at night so we hung out in the patio section we waited for the table.    it seems that not many people know about this section since there were lots of folks hanging out in the entrance area when there were plenty of empty tables with lawn furniture in the patio area.   CPK's are pretty kid friendly.  Cheese pizza and alfredo pasta were devoured by the kids.  We had the roasted veggie salad and Hawaiian pizza.  Both were really good as usual CPK standards. Don't be afraid to sit outside even if it's chilly.  The outside patio has covers and space heaters so it was nice and warm. Also, there were plenty of TV's around so I could watch the bowl game while we waited! :-)

I've been to quite a few CPKs. While I enjoy the selections they have to offer, this particular location hasn't been the greatest. For more than one occasion, I've given this place a chance in improving our experiences there. I've never really had a problem waiting for a table. And most of the servers there were real kind and courteous. However, what makes this place less extravagant is the delivery of the food. I'm vegetarian and for a number of times, I would inform the servers specific instructions to be certain that there won't be ANY meat on my plate. Unfortunately, more than 70% of the time... there would always be at least one or two pieces of chicken found in my entree. What makes it worse is that I'd take my girlfriend (who is also vegetarian) here and she too would have the same experience. On one specific occasion, me and my girlfriend had ordered a salad. Surprisingly enough, there was no meat found lurking in our food. However, we found a strand of hair instead. We kindly asked our server to have our salad replaced, which she was more than happy to. A few minutes later, the manager came back and tries to accuse us that we had left the strand of hair in the salad... explaining that none of their cooks has long hair and all always wait hair pieces to hold their hairs up while they cook.  That was the final straw... I don't think I'll ever go back there after that specific incident.

I consider CPK just your ordinary place to grab a nice tasty salad and thin crust pizza.  When it comes to salad, I recommend the Original BBQ chicken chopped w/ Avocado and extra BBQ sauce on the side or the Original Chopped. Both are DELICIOUS! My favorite thin crust pizzas are the Sexy Sicilian and the Mesmerizing Margherita. If you love meat then the Sexy Sicilian is the one for you. She is SPICY and so Heart warming! If you are looking for something light and sweet then the Mesmerizing Margherita is your girl! One BITE and you'll be HOOKED! The service was below average at this location. The server was MIA the majority of the time. We had to remind her to bring our condiments multiple times.  On another note, she got our bill wrong and took FOREVER to correct it. I just wanted to tell her, "Get it together Baby GIRL!" but I held back. Everyone has bad days and maybe this was hers.  I never expect too much of this place.  So don't get your hopes too HIGH if you are expecting a Gourmet Salad or Pie.

My family and I came here for my birthday... The pizza was wonderful !!  But I'm writing this review because the server we had was out of this world....He was the nicest guy ever!! His name is Josh..We really enjoyed sitting outside by the fire pit.. CPK is lucky to have josh working for them,what a super nice guy...

Cpk has a variety of choices you can choose, from their popular selection of pizzas to pasta to salad and etc. I ordered the hawaiian bbq pizza while my friend ordered pasta and both nonetheless tasted amazing. The service was great and I think it was the manager who went around asking everyone how their food was. I personally thought that was very sweet even though it was pretty awkward because my mouth was stuffed lol. Overall, I really liked my experience there and the food tasted amazing (esp my pizza). Definitely a place added to my list of going again soon.
Brett, Eric, and Andrew were precious waiters, really made me feel at home. While the food was delicious, the service was outstanding.

I had a CPK gift card so I used it to help cater my party yesterday. I felt that the food was waaaaay overpriced and so did my guests when I told them how much it was. "Especially for the quality" is what some of them said, and I agreed.  These 2 stars are for making my life a little easier because I didn't have to cook, and for the girl that took my payment for being so nice and accommodating. I will not be going back, if I can possibly avoid it.

I don't know whether my taste bud has changed or the food has changed. I used to love the entire menu at CPK. From their spinach artichoke dip to the chicken dumplings, santa fe pizza (which they got rid of) and of course my favorite, the chicken tequila fettucine. It has always been an enjoyable dinner everytime i've been there and thats starting from about 10 years ago..? The last time i went, the fettucine noodles were a bit undercooked and the sauce for the chicken dumplings was a bit too tangy. I must say their complimentary bread there is good though. It's not hard and tasteless like other CPKs. It is actually soft and i usually end up ordering two plates of just bread.  Overall, staff was friendly, service overall was good. I was just disappointed with the food this time.

I usually love going to cpk for their delicious kung pao spaghetti. I moved right next to Bella Terra, perfect! My Hun and I tried this location out one night celebrating a promotion. We walked in at about 430 (usually when business is not very busy) and asked the hostess for a table for two. She says Okay give us one minute we will clean one for you. Sure, as I glance around the 20 empty booths in front of me. We waited for about 5 minutes til we were seated. Our server greeter us and didn't tell us his name (lucky for him). We asked him for waters to start and a bowl of soup. He brings that out then asks if we were ready to order. I asked if he can bring us a side of lemons then we will have an answer for him! Somebody else brings the lemons out for us a couple of minutes later. 10 minutes pass no signs of our server. We finished our soup and sat there waiting and waiting. So finally I grab another lady's attention and ask if she can put our orders in for us. She was very sweet and did just that. Our "server" then kept walking back and forth from our table but never checked in with us. We wanted to order drinks but weren't able to because he seriously never came back. Someone else drops off our food and still the server did not come by. Even though we were seated right next to literally right next to the p.o.s. System where he was putting in his orders. About two bites left in our food LO AND BEHOLD our server speaks to us!!! We ask him for the check (since we didn't know when we would ever see him again) and guess what....someone else closed it out for us!!! Man I did not want to tip that guy but I wanted to be fair to the people that he will tip out later that did help us. Being in the industry myself, I understand you get caught up at tables and things happen but the guy walked by us about a dozen times. He could have easily stopped for two seconds! Meanwhile, in front of us there was about four cpk employees eating and talking in front of us. People kept stopping by to talk to them and they were kinda loud. I wouldn't mind if I wasn't out celebrating and could hear your voice through my conversations. But really, how unprofessional. The food was pretty good but service is a big part of going out to eat. I'm very disappointed and don't plan on ever coming back.

Pizza is seldom more than cheap party food. It's never fancy--except at CPK. Yes, it's a lot more expensive. And depending on what you get, it may or may not be worth it. But I'm a fan of their Thai Chicken Pizza.

Great CPK.  Food is wonderful and everything I expect from a CPK.  This location has a very nice patio.  Well shaded and perfect for a summer afternoon.  The server we just had was awesome.  The only reason I did not give CPK all 5 stars is actually because of a rule I was made aware of by when i was being nosey.  I myself have a nice long mustache that I often groom with wax.  Our server had himself a very stylish mustache.  Looked very professional and we'll groomed.  I asked if he ever waxed it for design and I was made aware that they are not allowed to use wax to style.  The server was again very professional and said nothing negative about this rule.  He simply shared the info and went on about his duties as a great employee.  Knowing this was a rule was very strange to me and the very reason I could not give 5 stars.  This rule is unfounded, strange and slightly offensive.  Again, not the shared opinion of the server, but my personal opinion of a wearer of a fine mustache.

Another decent chain type restaurant. Most of the pizzas and salads here are pretty good. I do really like the morrocan chicken salad. Really good so this rating is mostly for that. The servers are usually nice and helpful with a couple of them being exceptional. There is one lady in particular, don't want to use her name without permission, but if you get a young pretty girl with strawberry-blond (ish) hair you are going to have great service. Oh and some of the desserts here are awesome!

CPK does a fine job with pizza, and this location is no exception. The white pizza was delicious, and I was sad to see it gone when I finished. The pear and gorgonzola is also a personal favorite, but I decided to mix it up this time.  The staff was all very friendly and prompt. Service overall was great. They also had this little computer monitor at each table, where you could keep track of your bill and play trivia games.  Plenty of TVs and seating, with a quality drink list. This is a CPK location that does everything right.
The staff here is so competent and friendly. Food is excellent for what it is., and with a decent price point.

Originally we(two kids and I) went to Macaroni Grill and didn't even have a good experience there so we got up and left and went to California Pizza Kitchen. Once we sat down we were greeted from the waitress within a couple of minutes.  She took our drink and appetizer order. Within five minutes we had our drinks and our order was taken for our food.  Within fifteen minutes we had our food.  We didn't even get a hello from a waiter or waitress the fifteen minutes we were sitting at Macaroni Grill. I'll never again go to Macaroni Grill. Horrible experience at Macaroni Grill.  Chelsea thanks for the good service at CPK.

On my Weekend Trip to Orange County....May 14-16...I stopped by CPK on saturday afternoon....and BOY O Boy was it a trek to find this spot in the Fashion Show Mall...Phewww!!!! Good thing the food was so good though. YUMMM!!! The bread was hot and good...the waitress was perfecto We had BBQ Pizza, Appetizers, Chicken Alfredo & Drinks Rather expensive for 3 people at lunch time though

CPK consistently has good pizzas for me to try :) I love the thai chicken pizza and I love the avocado egg rolls! Tortilla soup is also good but I wouldn't get the fried Mac and cheese. Overall good service (though they can be a bit busy at this location) and a semi good price (you get what you pay for). Also, I'm kind of sad that the revolving door is broken :(

Had Dinner at CPK tonight in Huntington Beach. We were in the area and decided to give it try. The food was good as usual, but the kudos go out to our waiter, Aaron!! He was GREAT! Super friendly, very profrssional, extremely attentive without being intrusive. Clean uniform, and really put together. Just have to say Aarons service was truly above and beyond! My Family and I decided that even though we have a CPK much closer to our home, the drive to the Huntington Beach location will be well worth it from now on!!! Next time your there, ask for Aaron, you'll be well taken care of!!
We came in here for a department lunch. The server was great, food was good and I was also told that they allow dogs in their patio.

I had a wonderful experience tonight! Phillip Soma was a wonderful host. He was extremely friendly and helpful! He came back to check on our table throughout the meal. I will definitely be going back soon!

The food wasn't as good as I recall it being years ago. We ordered the spinach and artichoke dip which was obviously previously dried or frozen and the tortilla chips were of lower quality than Tostitos.  The BBQ chicken pizza was alright. Not much sauce or seasoning and the chicken didn't taste like real chicken.  Geez!  This is CPK.  They are supposed to specialize in Pizza.  I really think they're missing the mark.

Worst gluten free pizza ever.  I mean seriously, the WORST.  The crust was mealy and cold and tasted like cardboard.  I cannot believe a place called "California Pizza Kitchen" would serve something so disgusting.

I've been to this CPK a couple of times and each time I have had good service.  The wait staff was always attentive.  I like how you can play with the Ziosk without having to wait for your bill and credit card to come back when it is taken by the waiter/waitress.  This system makes it every convenient.  I usually order the BBQ chicken chopped salad with avocado. Can't go wrong with that.  I also love this place because they donated a bunch of pizza boxes for an art lesson I am doing in my classroom.  My students and I really appreciate it!!! Thanks CPK!!!
Nice staff . Very clean location me and my family loved the food. a bit pricey but worth it .

First time at this location and it was great! Love the unlimited fresh-oven baguette with yummy extra virgin olive oil! Waitress was super nice. She refilled our drinks before we have to ask, and made my strawberry lemonade extra sweet like I requested! Although the mushroom pizza was an okay..I didn't like it.  Will come back for sure.

Called in an order for 2 large pizzas ( first timer) wasn't informed they had only one size! Drove 20 mins waited another 10 for curb side . Got home and realized I got 2 10 inch pizzas (6 slices) 14$ each! They lady I placed order with was from 3rd party call and acted annoyed she had to take my call.. I said 2 large she never said we have one size! I called and was informed they don't have large? I said that's ridiculous considering this is a pizza place !? Anyways talked to the manager who was nice and accommodating. Gave me 2 more for free! I hate to complain but this was irritating ! Good pizza but beware of personal size pizzas for 14$ each never again!

I've been coming to this location for about 4 years. This is my most fav CPK of all so far. The staff is always so friendly, and the waiter/waitresses are always great. They don't clutter you by checking on you every min but they don't ignore you either. They are really good about their timing. Jacqueline was a great bartender and Lance the manager was very pleasant. I've ordered several things there like pizza, pasta, beer, drinks, desserts, etc and I've always been pleased. Definitely go here!

I loooooove CPK. I love the environment here. It's not too loud nor too quiet, and it looks very clean here. When I go to CPK, I usually get the avocado club egg rolls to start off with. Then depending on the size of my party, I usually order one of many: hawaiian bbq chicken pizza, thai pizza, chicken tequila fettuccini pasta, waldorf chicken salad, or the bbq chopped salad. Their desserts are good too, and they have very good seasonal dessert. If you ever come here, ask to be seated in Daryl's or Heather's section. They're very attentive to their customers and are knowledgeable on the menu.

Welcome back to CPK... I was a CPK fan years ago when a good friend of mine worked at one. Overall they did a good job and took care of their guests. As the years passed the quality fell off, the service style changed and  what remained was a disappointment. Yesterday we decided to try it again, and I am really glad we did. From what we were told the new CEO is very hands on and is very involved in the resurrection. Every table was greeted by the manager, a very nice touch. The new bread, a welcome change baked every ten minutes or so.  The food quality seems up, the revised menu is a welcome change and a big bonus they switched after years of being a Pepsi house. They now offer Coke products including Coke Zero.. Bonus. Add in some very personable service from our waiter and overall we were very pleased and will be back. If you have not been in a few years, it's worth revisiting.

I will spare a depth description of being served raw food, a lack of apologies by anyone in a managerial position. Here is the email I sent to their management and to their corporate offices. messing up what I ordered is one thing, Serving me raw food and management to engaged in conversations with bar patrons is ridiculous and entirely inappropriate. In fairness I will alter this review to show what response they have given to me if I should ever hear back.  To Whom It May Concern: Yesterday June 5th 2014 I ate at your Huntington Beach location 7851 Edinger Ave at around 7 PM. My previous experiences eating at this and other CPK locations has always been good and the quality of food has also been good. However yesterday the management and cooking staff failed miserably and I can assure you I will not be returning to this location ever again. The issue surrounds what I ordered and the way in which is was cooked, or should I say in this case, dangerously undercooked. I ordered the Chicken Picatta, something I tend to order often when I visit CPK. David, our server who was the only pleasant part of this meal was attentive and brought my food to me and the rest of my party in a very timely and professional manner. I began to eat the dish and got pretty well through it before I realized that the chicken I was eating was raw inside. While I understand there can be some occasional miscommunications with the kitchen staff over the timeliness of the orders and the items within an order, this was ridiculous. The other two people in our party of three got their food first, mine came about 4 minutes later. There should be no reason since I was the last one served for my food to not have been fully cooked. This is inexcusable to me and David our server was not to blame. When I brought the issue to his attention he was very quick to remedy it and what appeared to be just a host, came by to let me know the new piece of chicken and pasta was being cooked.  What is annoying about this to me and what I hope you will address to me is why a member of management did not personally come to my table and apologize? I would have understood in spite of concerns I might have for my health given that I have no idea how much raw chicken I had consumed. However no one from the CPK management team did so. Perhaps I can save you some time in wondering what your management was doing, they were standing at the bar for the length of our entire meal 1 hour and 3 minutes talking with two patrons at the bar. The conversations must have been quite important to not leave this post for that long of a time and certainly eclipsed the need to possibly go and personally address a guest who was just served raw poultry. I hope the conversation was worth the damage to your reputation, I am in the service industry and while I know your probably not the least bit concerned with Yelp or other venues where people can appraise their visits and give honest feedback, I feel many more consumers need to know what they can expect if something should go wrong at your restaurant.  I feel it is ridiculous I should come in and spend money somewhere on food, have it be served dangerously raw to me and not even have a member of your management say something as little as "we are sorry" to me. This location is in an area where there are several options for eating and considering the amount of time I spend in that area and the fact I live in Huntington I guess I will spend my money elsewhere. I most certainly will not be returning to your location given this ridiculous situation that I was willing to let go if your management had been able to pull themselves away from whatever life changing conversation they were having in order to say sorry.

My family and I eat here at least once a week. The food is great and the service is even better. We were lucky enough to get Roxy one evening and we've been asking for her ever since, we even wait until she has a table in her area just so we can experience her phenomenal service. She is what makes this place the best. She anticipates the needs of her guests and always seems to know what you want before you ask. She always has a smile on her face and is so genuinely nice. I can't eat anywhere else anymore as the service just doesn't match up. Don't get me wrong, the food at CPK is very good, but I think Roxy's service makes it even better. It really is a pleasant environment to dine and while I am praising Roxy quite a bit, her colleagues also seem to be very on point and friendly. It's always such a pleasure to eat here. Definitely recommend.

So, yesterday after putting out my thread on any good places to eat at Bella Terra, i decided to go to King's Fish House. When i went there around 7 o clock there was a 45 minute wait. I wanted to try somewhere new, but I decided no meal is worth eating past 8. Went to CPK with a no wait line at all. The place was pretty packed, but i was able to get a table with my boyfriend and his two friends. Our waiter was friendly and helpful. He checked up on us frequently. i ordered the chicken club sandwich again. (focassia garlic and cheese bread with chicken, lettuce, avacado, and bacon ) w. a side of sedona tortilla soup. ) When it came out i was super excited to just go crazy on it, and take that first big CRUNCH like last time. SADLY it was NOT crunchy at all, it was soft and soggy... i was able to bend the bread like it was nothing. I was so disappointed, i knew if i continued to eat; i would have left upset and not content. I HATE complaining, but I had to do it. I kindly told my waiter can he take it back, and make the bread toasty because it was just too soggy. He was sorry, brought it to the back, and got it toasted. It came back out to me how i wanted. Nice golden brown with a crusty exterior. It was way better, and he even said, " wow that does look better" . I was a little disappointed that i really enjoyed my food last time, and this time it was somewhat a drag, but it's all good.  Better luck next time.

Came in here with a group of 5 for a childs birthday. I've never been a fan of funny pizzas, like the BBQ Chicken pizza but some of the group seemed to love them. I had the fettuccine with the creamy garlic sauce and paid an extra $4 for chicken. To be honest, it was unimpressive.....you could tell by looking at the color of the noodles on top that it sat under a heat lamp for a couple minutes....and $4 for an extra ounce or two of chicken seemed a bit much. The creamy garlic sauce was actually kinda bland...I considered returning it for a moment....but didn't want to wait for another dish. It wasn't horrible....just not up to par with most restaurants that I'd order this at.  On the plus side........the service was terrific and everyone else seemed happy with their meals. We got a seat in about 15 minutes...not bad for a Saturday night.  Also there's a $5 coupon that comes up on Yelp when you check in. But it's a little misleading....you have to join their "Club" to redeem it.

Brett is the best server I have ever had at any restaurant! He is very good at connecting with his customers, as well as the manager Eric, super super SUPER sweet men, definitely made my experience here more enjoyable! Ps, Eric and Brett have the most amazing mustaches I've ever seen wow!

I ordered tha roasted vegetable salad and it was amaaaaaazzziiinnggg! All tha textures I could have wanted from a dish, so many flavors, and warm and cold mixture hit tha spot! 5 stars for tha salad!  Other than that everything else was decent: service, atmosphere, etc. We came on a Friday night and had no wait, so that's a plus (we got a booth to ourselves, me and bf).  What was cool tho was that we could pay tha bill using card with this little machine on tha table so we didn't need to wait for tha waitress! :] So overall, great but not extraordinary.

We went to CPK around 3 pm on a Saturday, and as expected, the restaurant was not crowded. With that being said, our waitress forgot our bread order, and it came out literally a minute before our food arrived. With the restaurant three quarters empty, there was no excuse for that to happen. On the plus side, the way they bake their new style of bread is delicious, and I greatly enjoyed the veggie pizza with goat cheese.

Pizzas are great!!! Salads overpriced (considering their size) management good . but food servers could be better but lack motivation to serves guest . I honestly keep going back because of their whole wheat dough. And Chicken tequila pasta is one of a kind !

This restaurant in located in the Bella Terra, but it is separated from the heart of Bella Terra by a large parking lot.  The interior of this restaurant is brightly lit, unlike the Cheese Cake Factory nearby. The food here is ok.  It is nothing spectacular.  I normally always order a strawberry lemonade when I dine out, but I would avoid ordering it at CPK.  The strawberry lemonade tasted like Minute Maid lemonade.  It didn't taste fresh like the ones at the Cheese Cake Factory or Black Angus. Our server was very friendly and attentive.  She was really good at making us laugh.  I would say this place has great service overall.   The only problem with CPK is their food.  I'm just not a fan.  Sorry!

The food here is really good, but if you don't like onions beware; they put onions on a lot of their pizzas. The service is OK, it's not the best, you really have to come when they aren't too busy. Also, when they are really busy they run out of lots of ingredients for the popular pizza, which kind of sucks. But I usually come at random times when they aren't busy and have a great experience. Also, if you ask they give you free bread and butter before your food comes out, but you have to ask or they won't do it.

Got the Spinach Artichoke dip and when it came out the chips were really stale.  We told the waiter and he brought out new chips, but they were the exact same, really stale.  He said that was the only chips they had. I also ordered pasta for my meal but when it came out it wasn't very hot and it had the texture like it had been sitting out for awhile, kind of pasty and dry. Overall the food wasn't great and neither was the service.  We asked them to take the artichoke dip off our bill and the manager was nice enough to do that.  So the service wasn't horrible at all, just very average. "Meh" describes our experience pretty well.

Dont go to this location. I like CPK as a whole but this location is not good. Food was not cooked and they were so scarce on the chicken. The service was just horrible.  The waitress came and just acted like she was mad at her job and did not want to serve us. All around experiance at this location NOT GOOD. I do not recomend this location of CPK.

I'm sure he meant well, but the bartender was EXTREMELY overbearing.  He must have asked me 10 times within 10 minutes to let him know if I had any questions, even though I told him the 1st time that I didn't.  And he must have asked me 10 times within 10 minutes if I wanted to order food, though I was already sitting at the bar ordering drinks and told him I was ok for now.  He just didn't want to take no for an answer, and it made me feel a bit uncomfortable.

I actually enjoy the pizzas here at CPK. I love the thin flat style of pizzas. My favorite pizzas here are the barbeque chicken, thai chicken, and jamaican jerk chicken. The salads here are also pretty great as well. I frequent this location a lot and the owner knows me well. He gave me a lot of coupons on one of my visit. Overall the staff at this location are pretty friendly and the food is pretty good.
The pizza is good but I wish they had a more broad menu so I'd have more to choose from. The service was pretty good. I wouldn't come here if you're looking to get something more than pizza.

This is a wake up call to all you nonbelievers!  Wake up and smell the cheeseburger pizza! That's right! Kill the two proverbial birds with one fantastic brick-oven baked pizza dough-stone. What's better than eating two of the best junk food meals ever together at the same time, in one bite, and in one meal? Nothing.  It's like eating a Big-Mac in pizza form. But I hear you say "eww I don't like Big-Macs". You, my friend, are liar and un-American! I also hear you say "eww I don't do chain restaurant pizza." Compromise for once, will ya?!  The carne asada pizza is also legit. Imagine eating a giant opened faced taco.  How awesome is that?!  VERY AWESOME! That's how awesome;) The Kiwi-lemonade is double tangy extraordinary. Perfect for this Las Vegas-esque summer.  It will make you fall head over heels  The service at this CPK is always good, plus the are always blasting the AC. They hiked up their prices a bit, which kinda seems a$$backwards during these days, but whatever. The complimentary bread service must be requested now, which is understandable since I've noticed many a patron leave untouched bread after they were all done. Why waste bread?  After your meal, you can walk over to Barnes and Noble and read some self-help books, if you need to.

We've come here for years and immediately have notice a number of cost saving measures that reflect on service.  Such as... no black cloth napkins, no sweeteners on the tables and the bread is delivered in joke portion.  For some reason the food delivery was too long.  Food quality has not been affected though.  Still tasty and the views are great of the coastal waters.
Thai crunch salad is great!! Owner keeps changing, hopefully this new one makes some upgrades!
The atmosphere, the food as well as service is perfect. I recommend this restaruant over any in Huntington Beach !

I've come here several times. I'm pleased with the service. Once my pizza was overcooked, and the manager offered me another one. I regret that they don't have miso shrimp salad at this restaurant anymore. However, by far, this is the best restaurant in CPK chain I've visited. The tiramisu is so yummy, and I love it.

This place is a-ok. It's just at the brink of making me a fan. It is one of our quick restaurant picks, but I always find myself hoping for more than what it actually delivers. You know when you read a menu... and it sounds good, but when you finally get it, it is as described, but something just isn't right? I always get that feeling. For example, the description for the Thai Pizza sounds great, interesting, and flavorful. However, when I get it... it is exactly as described, but just doesn't have that extra kick to it. The flavors just aren't distinct. They kind of roll around together. You end up wondering what you just ate and if you should be feeling satisfied. I feel the same about their other dishes. They definitely have interesting ideas, but the flavors need to be more distinguishable... the same goes for the texture of the food. Their food tends to be on the saltier side, which leaves my tongue a little numb at the end of the meal. I really recommend getting a salad and a pizza to share. It helps to balance it out. Just don't go crazy and get the Thai salad with a Thai pizza.  I do enjoy their appetizers quite a bit though!

Yum!!! Love this place! I would give it a 5 star if they didn't discontinue my favorite pizza, the buffalo kind! Lol. But overall this is a great place, love the food and our waiter/waitress is always kind :)

Love CPK! Been here a couple of times, and have had great service and the quality of their are really good. Hits the taste bud quite well! For 1st time customers, watch out for the revolving door. lol Can be a bit tricky to get through if you're not paying attention haha ... I'm pretty sure the workers wait for moments of those to have something to talk about. Anyways, this time, I got the Avocado club egg rolls ($9.75) and the Cranberry Walnut Chicken Salad sandwich ( not as good as it sounds lol) especially for $11 but still decent enough to finish it. Also, if your craving something that you want to hit the taste-bud, try their Roasted Artichoke, Spinach & Lime Chicken Pizza! Wow is all I can say. Overall this place is great but wish they can lower the price a bit, but then again, can't beat the quality of the food though so I guess it's worth it!

My partner and I have been going to CPK forever. We love the food and are always well taken care of by the entire staff. Every time we go there is at least one waiter that recognizes us... even the manager Bryan will take time come to come to our table to say hello.  FYI... We had the key-lime pie for dessert and it was amazing.

This location is CPK done right! After dining at the 2 other locations (South Coast + Irvine,) HB tops them all. The pizzas had the right amount of toppings and cheese without making the crisp, thin crust soggy, and that's what I was looking for the most. (Nothing makes me say,  "Ugh!" quite like a soggy pizza!) Service was excellent--which is always a plus, especially at a busy restaurant. Our server had the entire outside patio pretty much to herself, and she was great. I'm still more of a deep dish pizza person, though, so for pizza, I'd still prefer Bj's across the street.
They now have really cool electronic handheld menus. When you're not browsing the menu you can watch movie trailers & play trivia games.

Came by recently with a friend for dinner.  There two waiters at the bar which was where we sat.  The one with dark hair was preoccupied talking to the other waiter.  We sat down and ordered drinks and food.  Since the waiter w/dark hair was preoccupied blabbing, he forgot to give us utencils.  We later had to flag him to provide utencils.  Also, he didn't offer cracked pepper with the salad.  We ordered pizza which was to die for - YUMMY!  My 2 stars are for the service we received.  Maybe these 2 waiters could do their talking about their personal lives on their own time.  My advice is that they more training in serving otherwise let others take their jobs.

Their patio was filled with dirty furniture. Slow service. The food was marginal. For being an open air patio I felt stifled by the filth of the patio furniture, and the blinding yellow reflection caused by the yellow canopy.  Service was slow, and there was a terrible wafting odor on the patio. They squeeze you in like stump-legged chickens in a hatchery.  The Asian freaks seated at the table behind me kept bumping their chair to the back of my chair. The layout is awkward. I felt as though I was about to have a nervous breakdown it was such a clusterfuck. To top it off the music reel was super loud. I couldn't even concentrate on whatever conversation was going on.  Fk this place, you'd be better off eating a half eaten sandwich out of the gutter.

My very first introduction to California Pizza Kitchen was at this location. I heard about the hype and would see the frozen pizzas at the store, but just never had the time to try it, and for my first time at CPK this location was great!  Our waitress was extremely friendly and hospitable and would come by often enough that me and my friends drink glasses never went empty, which is big points for me since I hate having to flag down waiters every time I need something. I got the pepperoni pizza, and it was really good, had huge pepperonis and I loved the sauce and crust! Will definitely be coming to this CPK more often, their are others in the area, but I believe this one has the best service. Thanks CPK for a great dining experience, I will definitely be a recurring loyal customer!

I really Hate to do this but , I've had two very bad experiences here! The service- bad The food- horrible Everything else is one star. The other star is because I'm a nice guy !! I can't believe this chain hast  managed to be soo succssfull.

I don't like that stupid door! I walked through it backwards! and the host just stared at us and spun his finger in a circle.We got in and he told us we went the wrong way but it was impressive that we actually made it in. OOPS!  Everyone was super nice, but the food wasn't so eh but was overpriced. There was only one thing on the ENTIRE menu that I wanted to order.     We ordered the Hawaiian BBQ pizza (yum) + and the Baby Clams linguine in red sauce (yum but small portion!) = 30 bucks plus tip.  HOT DAMN!

Had lunch here at noon on June 20. I haven't been here for quite awhile, but upon my return, the hostess was super nice, made small talk with me as i was seated to my booth. Once i was seated, my server came up and asked if i wanted any drinks or appetizers. I think her name is Kelly (unsure though), but she was very nice. She came back with water, then took our order. While we were eating she would always check up on us. When i was about to leave, i didn't want to waste my strawberry lemonade so I asked for a cup, instead, she brought me out a brand new one!  Made my morning (i wake up around noon). She was so nice and such great service!  (: On to the food, for appetizer we got the White Corn Guacamole + Chips (i liked it, it's pretty small, but it's good): avocado, corn, bean in some kind of sauce with tortilla chips, for main course, i ordered the Garlic Cream Fettuccine with chicken (not too bad, a little creamy, didn't finish it in one serving), dessert: strawberry shortcake (new item: i didn't like the biscuit much, strawberries are good with the ice cream, but pretty sweet for me) After today, I would think of coming back more often now. I love the service and enjoyed my meal. (: BTW, it gets pretty busy around lunch time, good thing i came a little before noon and got a booth right away.
fast friendly service comfortable atmosphere smiles all around love the lunch specials

CPK is a big pizza favorite for me.  Along with that, they have a fantastic Top Shelf Long Island.  Fair warning: after 2 Long Islands I wouldn't drive; they're strong.   I tend to get the White Pizza with Applewood Bacon, but this time i went for the garlic roasted chicken with bacon.  It was fantastic.  Highly recommend.  We also started with the humus which was also good, but the pita bread with the humus filled me up a little too much.

It's been years since I've been to CPK so it was really nice that I was able to come back and receive great customer service especially on a Saturday night. I looked through yelp at the pictures that other Yelpers posted and got the avocado egg rolls, the Mac and cheese and we ordered the club pizza. It was delicious! And our waiter was amazing and friendly.

This CPK is one of the better ones. I just really hate their revolving door. I don't know why they had to split it into four. Makes it so damn annoying to walk through.   I haven't been here in a while but I hear they have little screens at the tables that you can use to order and pay now? I'll go check it out one of these days.  Service here is pretty much the same as in any other chain pizza-pasta restaurant.   They servers are nice and they'll come check on you from time to time. Nothing exceptional.  I always order the roasted garlic chicken pizza, and sometimes, the garlic cream fettuccine. Both are about $10, if I remember correctly. I like how they make the pizzas here. The crust is thin, but still thick enough so that it's not crunchy and charred. The fettuccine tastes okay, but it gets boring after a few bites. I had this brownie and ice cream thing once and it was good, but not worth the price. It's a pretty good place for lunch and dinner if you're feeling like having some extra "fancy" pizza.

When given a choice my kids always agree on CPK.  We usually order the same things each visit.  Hey, why fix it if it's not broken?  My older son orders the cheese pizza and my younger son orders fettuccine - they kinda share.  My husband will share the Chicken Club pizza with me, salad & pizza all in one & with yummy avocado on top too.  My husband has gotten a few different pasta dishes- the Tequila Chicken or Chicken Alfredo are his top choices.  The boys love ordering dessert,  a chocolate brownie & a chocolate fudge sundae & everyone leaves happy! :-)

Being from Chicago, a pizza that is less than an inch thick and topped with foofoo like barbecue sauce, pineapples, chicken, etc is a joke. I tried CPK kiosks rushing through airports and always laughed at the pizza and was turned off by the crappy sandwiches and salads. I actually gave away a $100 gift card to CPK because I was convinced they were all just like the lousy airport kiosks. So one day my friend that I gave the gift card to and I stumbled upon this place and I gave into the invite. It surprised me how nice this place was. I even tried the thin crust margarhita pizza and liked it. The menu selection is good and everyone in our party enjoyed their meal. Sorry to all my Chicago natives but CPK is actually good.

4 stars, this being said I base this review on what I ate there. The Chipotle Chicken pizza there is pretty awesome, I got it thin crust which made me not feel like I ate an entire pizza after eating an entire pizza. Service there is pretty standard, helpful with a smile, nothing out of the ordinary and not shitty at all.  Another plus is there's tv's everywhere, if you're into sports, not that I am, tonight you could have easily been watching 10 tall dudes huffing and puffing trying to get an orange ball in a hoop that's 10 feet up.  CPK def did a good job of giving you a bunch of easy to understand pizza's not like some spots I've been in LA where I can't even spell the ingredients because it's so fancy.  My sister did the dasterdly deed of getting a piece of red velvet cake for dessert. Good god, this thing was huge, no wonder one piece of that is the same caloric count as an entire meal. I had 2 small bites so I didn't feel too shitty for eating it, especially after consuming an entire pizza, and not even on cheat day mind you. So yes, if you want a good chain pizza place for sit down, that doesn't have a bunch of shitty arcade games, this is probably the place for you.

Don't get stuck seated in the bartender service area tables. You'll wait and have your requests summarily ignored. Not the server's fault, just spread too thin. I watched two different parties of two wait at the bar until they finally left for lack of greeting. I've been a long time loyal customer, but never experienced such a crappy visit as this evening. Pizza was still nice. But if you're sucker enough to spend $15 on the "Roasted Veg Salad",  expect a poorly dressed handful of wilted, browning and stale lettuce with a tablespoon or two of unrecognizable paste of eggplant and roasted pepper. Oh, nearly forgot the teaspoon of "roasted corn"... There was supposed to be asparagus in here, but it was MIA. Add a couple sorry and dry artichoke hearts ("warmed" so I know they made this train wreck to order...) and you're looking at maybe a $0.75 food cost. MAJOR RIPOFF $$$! The server seemed surprised when I asked for a little more dressing, and wow did we wait on that request. This place used to rock it. The $80 bill leaves me looking for a new go-to. Sad to take it out of the rotation.
The food here is ok and our waiter was really nice, just wish they had a bigger menu lol

I love CPK to start with. Their food is delicious. I feel however that the service here is lacking. Not only did I have to ask for everything, including silverware and napkins, but they couldn't figure out how to change the channel on the television. Also, the tension between the staff is so apparent, that it shows through and made my party feel uncomfortable. The "management" was weak as best. Chelsea at the bar was the only redeeming quality of this location.

I feel like the food is too expensive for what it is but it is always good. This one is probably the best one I have been to so far and I always have good time even though I am not a big fan of their pizzas. I like everything else though just every time I go I never crave pizza.  I have always had great experience every time I go there.

We LOVE, LOVE, LOVE, this CPK. Even though there is one closer to our home (the Long Beach location) we come here. The staff is always super friendly, the food is always delish and it just  has a great vibe. After we went once, the manager knew our names and he always comes by to say hello and personally check on us, I see him do this often. Bryan is an amazing manager and Ryan always takes special care of us and all his cusomers. Great food and great customer service. And i could live on the Lava cake... Way to rock it, CPK !!!

Service was ok but DO NOT ORDER THE FRIED MAC AND CHEESE!!! it was the driest thing i have ever eaten way overcooked, and it tasted 3 or 4 days old ,and  i was just amazed that whoever served me that garbage could care less, 0 standards .

This CPK is beyond and I know a thing or seven about CPK's!  Let me preface this my stating that I get food from CPK like once a week, mostly near my office in Tustin/Irvine and this was like my second or third visit to the HB location near my house.  We came in on a Monday and I was having a terrible day, was in a horrible mood and was just feeling grumpy to the extreme.  This visit not only lifted my mood, but staff was so great, I'd say they made my day...no week!   But I digress, the staff was kind, friendly and made me feel a little bit like a princess; their service was dynamite.  One thing I noticed was that not only were their waiters super great, but the bussers were amaze-balls as well.  The manager even came by to greet us, which I thought was super cool.  In this economy, I meet a lot of managers who come to tables to greet customers, but they usually feel forced, but here it didn't.  He was so kind (I wish I remembered his name!), he wasn't overbearing and was the perfect compliment to our meal.   By the time we left, my pizza hating boyfriend was asking to eat his leftovers for dinner and was actively discussing when we'd go back--mission success! Favey items: Vegetarian with Eggplant Pizza(whole wheat crust) Smashed Pea and Barley Soup

I'm not a fan of CPK at all....BUT this location is BY FAR the nicest and best executed location I have ever been to! Gorgeous interior, service super professional, quality of food seemed better than Ive had at other locations in the past. That ziosk thing is perfect for paying!  Hate waiting for servers! Great Bella Terra spot to eat and shop
Quick service....our server nicole was nice and patient with us, also on top of refilling my drink...our food came quick and yummy. Most def come back with good service like we got.
This place has touchpads at each table -- pretty cool and entertaining. The service here is very nice and helpful.  I recommend trying the steak tacos; steak tacos? At CPK? YES.

This was the most disgusting food I've ever had. I ordered some pasta which tasted like it had been sitting out all day. It was dry and thick and bland. Ew. My boyfriend at the time ordered a pizza which was just some thin little burnt crust with a dash of some sause and toppings thrown on top. the drinks we had were good and the service was nice.

Average food, definately not worth having to wait for a table.  Had a gift card, glad I didn't have to pay.  Service was actually the best part, that's why I gave 3 stars. Food, not so much. Won't go back (unless we get another gift card).

I love this place! My girlfriends and I went here for dinner and  it was perfect.  We felt like sharing our meal.  We chose the waldorf chicken salad and hawaiian pizza with the wheat crust and chocolate souffle for dessert.  It was all so yummy... nothing left to spare, well except for some of the dessert.  We were pretty full.  (a good sign)  One of my friends got a bowl of soup as an appetizer. She was super hungry.  We had the Korean BBQ beef tacos for appetizers also but it was way too spicy for me but my friends loved it. I loved how fresh the salad tasted and the pizza was yum yum delicious and juicy....perfect dinner for what I was craving.  The BBQ sauce was sweet and tangy and the pineapples were juicy as well.  Our dessert was pretty good...a nice hefty serving of vanilla bean ice cream with a chocolate souffle and loads of chocolate syrup.  The souffle was very chocolatey. The artwork in the place was pretty cool. It has painted CPK boxes framed on the wall all over the restaurant.  Very nice.  The service was great! There was this cool ziosk at our table where we could order, check out menu and pay for bill.  We had wait service though so we only used it to check out the desserts to choose from.  I loved that idea.  How cool is that!
On point - EVERY TIME. Love, love, love this place. Always clean, good service and in view of tele.

I hadn't been here in a few years. I'm not one to leave crappy reviews but I was pretty under-impressed, and so was my family. We started with the lettuce wrap appetizer as well as the spinach artichoke dip. The lettuce wraps were excellent. The artichoke dip was nothing special, and the chips it came with seemed a little stale. Most of my family got pizza. I got the club pizza and was pretty underwhelmed by it. All the flavors were there, but it was lacking. It is supposed to come with hand-tossed crust (I got the wheat crust) and I was disappointed because it seemed super thin. I was hoping "hand-tossed" meant it would be more traditional crust, but it was thin, overly chewy and difficult to eat. My boyfriend got the garlic chicken pizza and while the flavors were okay, there was no sauce at all. Just melted cheese with chicken, onions, and garlic on a thin, tough crust. Meh. Based on the food I'd give it 2 stars, but the atmosphere is nice and service was great so I gave it 3. Plus, from my past experience the salads here are good. I won't be back anytime soon, though.

I've been here plenty of times.  The last time I came was for dinner on the 4th of July.  They were pretty dead, but the employees were all extremely friendly.  I didn't like my meal very much, but my cousin loved her pasta.  I wish they had a few more healthy options.

Horrible! Don't eat here! Under cooked chicken and hair found in pizza. When speaking to the manager she made light of the situation. Found out other people that have gone here have found hair in their food as well. I contacted their corporate office and the health department. My husband and I use to go here all the time. Don't know if they are under new management or what but health hazard for sure. So disgusted. To top it off the manager asked overall how was the service. Moron. Hope they get shut down. I'd give it negative stars if I could!

6.14.08: Exploring the OC area I begin to eat the same chains that are also located in the LA County. Well I stepped inside and I had to do a double take. The whole layout and number of booths and tables was either exact or close to the one often visit in West Covina. It was like déjà vu or something.  The wait was not bad at all. We got lucky and were seated right away. The only thing was their service. It was really really slow. She was nice but freaking slow. ! ! It took forever for her to take our orders and we spent 2 hours total just waiting and eating. Usually its like 1 hour and the other hour or hours are spent talking after the meal.  So instead of the 4 stars I had to give this location a 3. I love the food though. The BBQ chicken pizza and the chicken oriental salad was awesome blossom!

All of these are the same.  The food is good but not great.  It is noisy, but that is what you expect when coming here.  Friendly servers and have been to this location several times and have never had a problem.  Would go back again.

This is one of my favorite restaurants. I love their Tortilla soup and most of all their Mango Iced Tea which is a drink i cannot live without. I went there with one of my gurliees for dinner to catch up. We had the Caesar salad...we decided to share the full size. She got a BBQ chicken pizza and i i got the marinara pasta w/ chicken and shrimp (forgot the correct name). It was all soooo delicious, loved it. The waiter was polite and always made sure we had what we needed, refilled our drinks, and was very attentive.  The atmosphere was great, we decided to sit inside, very nice setting. If you like pasta and love marinara sauce like i do, i recommend getting that pasta marinara. If you love pizza go with the Original BBQ Pizza melts in your mouth, awesome taste. Loved my experience overall, this was actually one of my many visits there. CPK HB Bella Terra is the best!!

I visit this location regularly. The staff is very friendly and professional. I credit the manager of this location with running such a clean and welcoming restaurant. One of my favorites is the bbq chicken chop salad, get a half it will be more than enough. On a cold day the spaghetti is great. Honestly every thing on the menu is great.....

All of the food here is delicious.  The pizzas are personal size, but can be shares with another to save room for the best dessert they have...the warm butter cake!  They just recently changed the appetizer bread which is much better than the bread and butter they had before!

Their food is excellent, but more importantly, the experience is made more memorable and satisfying if you are served by Roxy. She is an awesome and beautiful human being. We go there because of her. She is the best!!!!  If you visit the place, ask for her table. You will love the service, and the food.
If you are looking for an average meal then look no further.  Your new honey wheat dough tastes very similar to dirt...does this mean it's organic?

I called in an order for a gluten free BBQ chicken pizza at 4:40PM on a Sunday.  The woman on the phone said that it would be ready at 5PM and to call when I'm at curb side to go.  I arrive at 5:05PM and call.  They told me there was no record of my order and hung up on me.  I called back, saying I think the call got dropped, and they said that they don't have an order for me (and that maybe the call center sent it to the wrong location).  The guy on the phone said that they can expedite it for me and it will be ready in 5 minutes.  I thanked him and waited in car.  Ten minutes later,  no one has come out with my pizza so I walk inside.  They told me it would be another 10 minutes until it's ready.  I never received an apology for this, and will not be returning.  When my pizza finally did arrive (at 5:30PM) they handed it to me and again, did not say sorry.  Pizza is burnt, and I'm pretty sure it's not even gluten free even though I told them I have a gluten allergy.
Good salads and pizzas. We bring visitors, at times who want more on the menu than pizza. Kid friendly, and consistent menu. For a chain - it's a good bet.

My wife and I wanted to treat my Niece, her husband and 3 children to a nice lunch.  Well, they got lunch but that's all. Nice, not so much. The food took an inordinately long time to come to the table and when it did one of the orders was prepared wrong so it had to go back.  Fifteen minutes later, it finally arrived prepared properly. And my "spicy" Moroccan salad was so bland and tasteless any real Moroccan would have been insulted.

Oh my goodness!!! You have to get the BBQ Chicken pizza, extra cilantro! They also offer a decent wine selection. My boyfriend and I enjoyed a glass of wine while we waited to be seated. Very good date night spot! Our server Ethan was excellent. Very friendly and had perfect timing! I have a feeling we will be returning for our next few dates! YUM!

This CPK is probably the best one I've been to so far. We walked through the revolving door and my family was seated right away (theres a choice between dining inside or on the outside deck). The service was amazing: our waiter was quick with taking our orders, refilling drinks, checking up on us and just being exteremely friendly overall. We ordered 3 pizzas and it took about 20 minutes for them to come out. I definately recommend the new Habaneros Carnitas Pizza (Slow-roasted pulled pork, red onions, cilantro pesto, Mozzarella and Queso Quesadilla cheese with SPICY habanero salsa). SOOOOO GOOOOOOD!!!

Went here last week after a week long "cleansing" (the hardest, most irritable damned week of my life!)...the friggin smell wafting over from across the lot made me giddy with happiness lol. I had been on nothing but soups and raw foods for The two days after the fast, so I def had to come back with a bang lol. I love cpk so 5 stars purely for the food...the carne aside, chipotle with steak, and red velvet cake are among my favorites. I swear that cake is the best thing you'll ever put in your mouth. That was the first thing I had to break my raw foods diet and I melted into every bite. Oooo so good! Kinda dissapointed that i only had room for one slice of the carne aside dammit! Lol. Ok so now to the service....well, it was bad. My biggest pet peeve is having a damn near empty restaurant with bad service....what's the excuse? Nothing! Everything just took a long time and I just don't appreciate that. The hostess was busy chatting up a storm and left us waiting at an empty register for a good few mintues before noticing us. When seated, it took a long while before the waiter came to take our order. He only came over after I loudly complained. This particular location is consistently lax when it comes to service. Its the closest location to me so i put up with it just for the food.  I should just start ordering my food to go :)
overprice? yes food alright? yes fancy(ISH) place to do like a hs bday dinner? sure. but seriously on the overprice. i like their thai chicken pasta and their bbq pizza. delish!
I love CPK food - salads but the service at the bar is terrible - slow, slow, slow.

Maybe this place just isn't for me but I've been pretty disappointed by this place every time I've come here.  The food is pretty average, and definitely not worth the price you pay for it.  I ordered a mushroom pizza and the mushrooms had good flavor, but the crust, sauce, and cheese were all very lacking.  I also ordered the fried artichoke hearts because they're always a favorite of mine, but at CPK there attempt to make them healthier bu frying them in panko just makes them too boring.  The lemonade was very good, but even my husband didn't enjoy his meal of shrimp lettuce wraps and a salad.  Needless to say I think I've had enough of this place, and next time I'm looking for good pizza I'll look elsewhere

i was going to give them only 2 stars because they took the steak  pizza and hamburger pizza off the menu.. Then i found the steak stramboly it is amazing.... my wife is so happy because she loves this place and i could never find anything i like there.. until now..
I love the ginger potstickers they have.  I will gladly go just for these.  There pizza is just ok.  Nothing to write home about.  The pasta is kinda of crappy.

Yes, I know CPK isn't "gourment" or "trendy" or "hip", but damn it...it's pretty freakin' good. I highly recommend that you get your pie on a honey wheat crust. This seems like a good location too, but aren't they all pretty much the same?!  Word.
Chipotle Chicken Pizza!!!!!!! The only reason why I give this place 4 stars.  And maybe cause I also like their bread.  That's it.

I have been eating at CPK since their first one in Beverly Hills and have always found them to be a great place to eat.  I was not so pleased this last time in HB.  Its not that it was bad....its that was a different taste.  I had my usuall and it had a different taste.  The manager was very understanding and wanted to help.  Perhaps this location changes some of its ingrediants?

My boyfriend and I use to come here all the time! I love love love their raspberry lemon martinis too but now you couldn't pay me to eat here. We came for a Birthday dinner one night and we were the second to last group in the restaurant before closing. Someone in our party notices a giant roach on the floor! I freaked but as soon as we started looking around.... we saw one crawling on the table across from us, two run across the floor, and one SO big that we could see it sitting on top of a booth several booths away! I ran to the bathroom and threw up because I was so disgusted.....Now, for the cherry..... When we told the manager, he pretended to not see them. One ran across his feet as he was denying the fact that they had no roaches. Finally, he got angry and said that we could "just go."  DIsgusting! I understand that restaurants can't keep them all out but when they are running all over your restaurant?! Gross. I just make the drive to the Specrum if I'm craving a martini.

i love the kung pao spaghetti at this place. it had a nice sweet and sour taste to it, with green onions and peanuts. i had them hold the chili peppers though so i dont know how spicy the dish is. i would have liked seconds but it was kinda costly. around $13 or something around there. and i had the strawberry italian soda, less flavorful than i thought it would have. that cost another $2. then as a group, we ordered the red velvet cake. but the waiter later asked us if we wanted ice cream with it.. not realizing they would charge us extra. but its okay, just another $1.50. it was a really good cake, yum. the customer service is an A+++++++. i also had a bite of the scampi shrimp pizza. i would give it a 3.5. but my spaghetti was definitely better. =) oo... btw, happy new year!
there's not a lot of things on the menu that sounds appetizing to me, but i love their chicken garlic pizza
its just okay. the bread they give is horrible. the jamboylia (sp?) pasta is just average. nothing special. go to cheesecake factory. everything's better.

Sat at the bar top with my six year old son.  Food was up to the usually CPK standards,  Our server was the bartender on duty, Millard.  He really shined - quick and courteous;  offering up several menu delicious suggestions.
Always a great dining experience. Great service and great food. I go here with family members all of the time.
The garlic chicken pizza & the Waldorf salad both rock!

My friends and I tend to enjoy coming here on relaxing Sundays.  I don't like sitting inside most of the time, as it can be rather loud.  The outside seating has heaters, so its still comfortable outside on colder nights. A large number of choices when it comes to pizza, pretty good pasta as well.  My fiancee loves the Itialin Sodas the have available.  I would suggest trying the Kiwi Lemonade if you like Kiwi.   Quite good, not too pricey, and a good sit back and relax with friends place.

Pros: Wide selection of gourmet style pizzas with out of the ordinary ingredients. Cons: Often long wait times especially on weekends. Best Dish: Price - $13.79 - Sicilian Pizza. This pizza has an extremely thin and crunchy crust, and is topped with pepperoni, salami, and sausage. Very tasty. This restaurant is conveniently located in the Bella Terra shopping center and parking is usually adequate around the restaurant. The service is very average as they are pretty fully staffed normally.  I have very fond memories of the first CPK I've ever eaten at, and ironically it was not in California, but at the Mirage in Las Vegas. I've always had a soft spot for this place ever since and am never disappointed to eat here.

I have been here a few times now and those few times have been pretty great. The food, the wine and the atmosphere are all enjoyable. There was one time that I went and my fiancee and I were sat outside which wasn't a problem until a 9-year-old's birthday party took up residence to our direct left. Even with that going on, we still managed to enjoy our date because the food that day was particularly delicious. I had the Tomato Basil Spaghettini with goat cheese and he had the Meat Craver's Pizza. I recommend them both, by the way. I also recommend the Korean Barbeque Steak Tacos. Get them as an appetizer because they are small but really delicious. As for the service, I have no complaints.
CPK curb side service, 5 stars all the way!!
excellent!!  i always get the BBQ chicken pizza with a side of the chiese chicken salad.  Its always great and clean.  probably my favorite restaurant in Huntington Beach, Ca.
Jamaican Jerk Pizza!!! That's all I've got to say :]

I'm Sure It Should Have A Better Rating Because I Only Had BBQ Chicken Salad- Costs 12.49 Tastes Good Kung Pao Spagetti-Costs 12.99 Too Salty I Only Ate It When I Mixed It With The Salad Coke-2.50 Iced Tea-2.50 Unlimited Refills Service Is Good But My Waiter Seemed To Be Angry Or Bothered..Took Forever For Check  Restaurant Is Very Clean

My good friend and I had just come from a movie. Upon arrival, we explained we were cold and would prefer a booth. The hostess made us feel very welcome and sat us in a nice booth, right away and away from the cold.  Roxanne, our server came over right away as well, greeted us warmly and took our beverage order. We explained that we might order an appetizer but since we were unfamiliar with your menu we asked for some bread to tide us over which she brought right away, along with some delicious flavored olive oil! Yum! After tasting it we were intrigued and when Roxanne checked back to see if we were ready to order we got in a really fun conversation with her about it, the type of conversation where you realize you're going to have a lovely meal because your sever loves her job, cares about her customers and is really fun, to boot! She was very  knowledgeable, explained what seasoning they put in the olive oil and that it is made fresh every day! Upon our request, she was even gracious enough to give us the brand of olive oil you use. We told her we still weren't quite ready to order so she said she would check back.  We were having so much fun talking and tasting and enjoying the bread and olive oil! Roxanne came back in a timely manner and again, being very knowledgeable and professional answered all our questions about the menu. She said that she would recommend what we were considering so we placed our order. Roxanne must have noticed that we finished our bread and was sweet enough to bring us more and more olive oil, too!  We ordered the lettuce wraps and we did not have to wait long at all! They were absolutely delish! We loved the ginger-sesame sauce and me, being a spice nut, I asked if CPK had any kind of hot sauce. Roxanne offered two kinds and I went wild over the habanero one! It tasted homemade but I forgot to ask. It was a decent portion but when we ran out of lettuce Roxanne cheerfully brought us more. Gotta get my veggies! LOL! Well, we had an amazing meal! Roxanne could not have been nicer and checked back several times. She took care of all our needs and even brought containers so we could take home our bread and olive oil! What a sweet gesture! Roxanne is top notch and definitely a KEEPER!!! Thanks, Roxanne for making our evening so enjoyable! You ROCK Roxanne! You deserve a raise and to be employee of the month (if you have that? Ha!)! We will be back very soon for more lettuce wraps, bread, olive oil and to try something new as well! CPK is tops in my book now !!! See ya soon!!!

When this place first opened, it had a lot of kinks to work out. Waiters were poor, the food was slow, and they routinely messed up orders. Now that it's been around for a few years, the whole establishment has improved significantly. If you're familiar with the CPK menu, this location will give you more of the same. Protip #1: Parking for this location is typically horrible (it's part of a huge mall). You might be inclined to park near the building on a Friday or Saturday, but don't. Try parking closer to the Staples and cross the street. Protip #2: If you order take-out, check your order before leaving (literally dig through the takeout bag). They've screwed my order up more than once.
The service is great, the food is wonderful and my grandson loves the kiosk at each table where you can fill out a survey and pay your tab.
I really like there pizzas here, always the same and that is a good thing to me, consistent! Clean place great staff good bar!!

My co-workers and I came to this location to celebrate one of their birthdays.  We called ahead to make a reservation since we would be a party of 6.  I mentioned to the host that we were celebrating a birthday (he said they provide a sundae) but apparently that information was never conveyed to the server since nothing ever happened with that.  Even though it was nearly empty when we arrived, it took several minutes to be acknowledged and submit our drink order.  Customers after us were being served their food before the server took our food order.  We were excited to see the kiosk on the table, hoping this would speed the process of paying the tab.  This is not a tool you can use when you're paying cash as partial payment so we still needed to rely on our server (who had pretty much disappeared by this point).  What should have been an hour lunch from beginning to end (at the most!!) turned into an hour and a half, which made us late getting back to the office.  And the food wasn't even that good!!!  I would share the name of our server but given the level of the service that she provided, I would hope her CPK career would be short-lived anyway.

Bleeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeegh. Ok, this is where I went from curious about CPK to *crosses fingers to make a religious symbol* back, BACK AWAY FROM ME, BEAST! Honestly, I had an open mind going in. I really did. I almost chose a burger place but I decided, hey, why not - let's try this cute little commercialized joint with my grandparents after a night of celebrating how I got my scholarship. The garlic shrimp pizza I got destroyed my stomach first of all. And everything was so decadent and outrageous - I just wanted a normal pizza for chrissakes! My old-school family was equally confused at what to do... but they ordered fairly normal "flavors".. and didn't get sick like I did. If there's one thing that I'm careful about, is that if I throw up or feel incredibly horrid after a meal, I stay away from that type of food forever. Not just "oh give it a month" or "try something similar at a completely different place". No, I never try it EVER again if it made me even slightly sick. So I'll never have CPK ever again because of this place. The staff was cute and friendly - one guy flirted with me in fact... but otherwise, no way would I ever recommend this place or any other branch to someone I want to survive through the meal.

Okay, this place is kick ass.  They have a new cordless computer at each table to view pictures of all the food.  What's better is when you are done, you can pay from your table by credit card and leave!!  the receipt spits out of the bottom of the little computer.  It was so cool and quick and easy.  And of course, the food was amazing as usual!

I think its weird that you have to ask for bread these days, but according to the waitress...they dont give it out to everyone anymore!  Blame it on the recession? who knows...  Anyway, things I LOVE:  chipotle chicken pizza (careful, its spicy!!)  Waldorf chicken salad  chicken chowder  their flavored lemonades and iced tea.  Yummy!!

My experience at this particular CPK was excellent Overall, it can be hit and miss. Service is usually better than average. Menu has evolved greatly over the tears and is now HUGE We had the Club Pizza and the Waldorf Salad, both new experiences for me and were great.  The lettuce tossed with mayo placed atop the pizza post cooking is a different concept for normal pizzerias anyway...not as new at CPK, as the BLT was the original pizza with the salad tossed with mayo being on top,and  was excellent, and the sweetness of the fruit contrasted the gorganzola nicely on the salad and the dressing was a perfect complement.  Our server was prompt, friendly and efficient Some other favorites are the Oriental Chicken Salad (not thai), the Thai chicken pizza or pasta, sausage pepper penne, and the chicken tequila pasta (probly not on the AHA list for heart healthy meals, but good nonetheless).

ahh CPK one of my favorite restaurants to eat at, just be cause of the food, NOT THE SERVICE! I'll say everytime i come here i order the same 3 things, especially if i come with friends i make them order what i want to eat because no one ever complains about what i like to eat because i only eat delicious stuff. Hell ill tell you what u need to order and you'll fall in loveeeee with it!! Ok lets start with pasta YOU HAVE TO TRY the CHICKEN TEQUILA FETTUCCINE.  It's absolutely perfect in every sense because if i dont have to season the pasta that means its PERFECT!  It's a spinach fettuccine in this oh so orgasmic savory creamy, fresh cilantro in a tequila-lime and jalapeño sauce very inriched flavor espcially if you  squeeze  lime in it, oh geez i remember when i first had it i came back for dinner to have it again it was that memorable to my taste buds! If you want a REALLY good salad always get the thai crunch salad, it's a perfect salad away from the ordinary bland american crap.  The mix of the peanut sauce with lime-cilantro sauce but mixing the two gives you this sweet and not quite sour but savory purfect mix of two dressing to make a good salad, but sometimes i notice they are stingy on the chicken probably the econmonys fault. but the best salad ever!! also NEVER get the Moroccan chicken salad its crap! and gross. oh miso salads pretty good too but thai crunch wins! For pizza i had a good amount of different types but my favorite is the sweet and spicy italian sausages, maybe im bias on this pizza cause this girl LOVES SAUSAGE! but yeah if your gonna order a pizza here dont get something lame like pepperoni, explore your taste buds and try the different arrays of taste for pizza. but if u want really good pizza go to Bj's across the street best pizza ever! So yeah those are the 3 things i always order with a sugar free peach ice tea also good. One thing.. the service god i must of gotten the worst waitress ever twice in a row, same waitress, with a different party of ppl on different days.  I have so say she was like what philipino or something she made me want to complain to the manager and when tipping i wanted to tip her a note saying "HERE'S A TIP, LEARN TO BE A BETTER WAITRESS OR YOU'LL NEVER GET GOOD TIP" ill say i came here sat in the table and it took her 5 minutes to greet us and get ask what drinks we wanted then another 15 minutes to get our drinks infact we got our drinks right before we got our food. then she never brought us bread untill i had to ask her, everyone was starving too, oh and she never brought us straws when we asked her after we got our drinks. SHE NEVER EVER EVER refilled any of our drinks and took forever to get my condiments of ranch, dijion sauce and red pepper, SERIOUSLY?!?! GEEZ THE RESTAURANT WASN'T BUSY AND YOUR NOT UNDERSTAFFED WTF IS WRONG WITH YOU GIRL!?!?!?! i hope she got fired because the next time i went to eat there and i got her it was like de javu, but this time i was with my friends and not my parents so giving her no tip was easy. other than that the other servers are cool just dont get that one girl u'll know if you get her because she'll make your experience terrible but then again i been to cpk over 50 times and the service is usally subpar to good except that one waitress, but the food will always be good!

Cpk has the bomb selection in pizza and delicious pastas. My top recommendations is the works pizza (combo), the jambalaya, the spinach artichoke dip, and the bbq chicken pizza. I also recommend adding a long island ice tea (alcoholic beverage for those who aren't of age) which pairs real nice with your meal. The staff here are nice and friendly although they could be a little bit more attentive. I shouldn't have to wait for 5 minutes to get crushed peppers and parmesan cheese. Overall though, this place is nice once in awhile but have it too often can break the bank!

I m not fan of pasta and never go to place to have pasta. But I fall in love with CPK's pasta's they are really good feels like homemade real deal. Only issue servers there are not quite enough servers compare size of place. But atmosphere/decoration is great. Hope they will increase # of servers so you will wait less.

Sweltering heat and we walked into the cool and inviting oasis that is CPK! Started off with a Strawberry Lime Margarita and glass of wine, cooled down a bit and we're ready to order and have another cool cocktail! Strawberry Mango cooler add Bacardi was refreshing, Pulled Carnitas Hsbenero pizza was delish, and the Pesto Cream Penne with chicken has great flavor, would ask for extra cream next time! Our server was a pleasure but we did miss our Favorite Manager Brian, say hello and then try the salted caramel pudding! Brian gifted us a sample and it has become one of my all time favorites!
