If you like delicious, pallet pleasing food, this is the place to visit!  The servers are always helpfull to help make our choice and we are always eager to try something new from a menus that hssn't disappointed us yet! See you guys again soon, thanks for a delicious meal AGAIN!
We had a soccer team dinner here and they did a great job! We had the whole patio and the service and food was great! They did a great job!

I went here Sunday night. Place was packed, so there was a wait for our food to arrive. A rather long wait. The wait was one of the first things my party noticed. Appetizers took about 15-20 minutes to arrive (lettuce chicken wraps) and our pizzas came out 15 minutes after (so 30 minutes from time of order). Another negative is the pizza I *always* get when I go to CPK is the Roasted Chicken Garlic - they "ran out" today. How do you run out of a pizza? I thought everything was made from scratch. If that's the case, how can you not make more? It's not like I went on a slow night, it was Sunday night.  I ordered the next best looking type of pizza on there - the Spinach Artichoke and Chicken. When it came out the crust was nearly burnt, it was hard as tack and I barely managed to finish the whole thing.  Our waiter was great, and I know it's not his fault the kitchen failed to produce probably one of their more popular pizzas, nor was it his fault the food turned out crappy.  I doubt I'll come back to this CPK - miss the one that was South Coast Plaza. Parking is shared in the bustling Bella Terra area, so be prepared to walk if you go on a busy night.
They renovated the menu and remodel the whole place. I always get the   and add bacon. Price jave gone up considerably also....

Ugh, I can't believe I ate the WHOLE thing.  Came here for lunch today for a work lunch. Even though my work is practically 20 ft from Bella Terra, I refuse to eat at the restaurants since they're all bland, overpriced chain establishments. However, we didn't want to drive anywhere so I figured a quick lunch at CPK would be sufficient. When we sat down at our booth, we both noticed that there are mini "kiosks" where you can scroll thru the menu, read news online and also pay for your bill. Pretty neat. For my meal, I ordered the Pepperoni pizza with wheat crust (boring, I know but I wanted to keep it simple). I've had this before at the Irvine location and it sucked but I was pleasantly surprised that this time around, the pizza tasted fresh and the dough had a good, chewy texture with a hint of sweetness. It was good but definitely not great given that it exceed my low expectations.  Overall, I would not come back here again due to the high prices ($12 for that Pepperoni pizza!) and mediocre food but at least CPK redeemed itself from my last dining experience.

Second time I go to CPK. First time to this particular store (Bella Terra). I really enjoyed the penne with shrimp. The flavor was great and the portions were good. Our server Kyle was very friendly and took good care of us. Overall I would recommend this place.

Went tonight 830 pm they put up chairs soon after we got there  by 8:50 pm they were all up look like it was already closed 10pm Is there closing time. Server started out good but at the end we were asking the manager to give us our bill because we never saw the server again and the manager had to put my salad away then the server came back and said he was helping a to go order I think there was other people  could have done that because the place was empty.

Not only are their pizza's made just right but they're other dishes including soups and salads are the bomb.  Very consistent and great service every time I visit.

First time I came to this cpk. Food is always good and the service was not too shabby. I highly recommend the tortilla soup, thai crunch salad, and pesto cream penne. You can never go wrong with cpk! Oh and one of the manager has a cool stache so extra points for that.

Ate here recently. It's been remodeled since my last visit. Somewhat Different menu as well, with several main courses added to compliment the standard pizza and salad choices CPK s known for. Clean. Looks good. Comfortable seating. Host was spot on. Server was attentive. Food was ok. Not bad. Not great. Just ok. Noticed the manager constantly making the rounds making all the staff nervous by doing their jobs. Micromanaging does not good service make. You pay your staff to work. Let them do their jobs.

Thumbs up...Updated menu, better staff, new look which resolved noise issues.  The Garlic Chicken and Lobster Flatbread were very good.

I've decided to give CPK another chance since casting it off around 2006? Yes, if you're looking for a fantastic meal, then you're at the wrong place. But it does deliver in getting you full and semi pleased with what you ate. The artichoke dip here was definitely bland, almost no seasoning went into making it, and I could tell that there was a lot more oil/grease than there probably shold have been. I tried the hawaiian pizza and the pesto penne pasta. The pizza was okay, decent size, thinner crust, but nothing I felt was out of this world. I actually enjoyed my pasta, just enough sauce to coat the pasta, and tasted light. 2.50 to add chicken?!? bleh. And as mentioned, you have to say you want bread in order to get it. Pretty weird if you ask me especially since the server could easily say "would you like some bread" instead of making patrons think weird things about the chain restaurant. P.S. this location has a nice open feel to it, and I guess CPKs in general are decorated nicely inside.

I can't seem to get tired of their scilian pizza. Artichoke dip here is decent. Quick and easy dinner
Awesome, and I'm a restauranteur, so I  know what I"m talking about.  Always consistent, always good speed of service, always fair to good staff, always see managers checking on things.  Great job.

I love the White Pizza. The spring rolls are wonderful, especially with the accompanying sauce. I tried the cream of asparagus soup and was overwhelmed with joy. The grilled veggie salad is one of my favorites (sans avo, of course). Add shrimp or salmon to it to beef it up a bit. For some reason the salmon is uncannily good here. Especially added to a salad. The artichoke dip is also nice. I know artichoke dip is almost always good but because of that, I think my standard of "good" artichoke is much higher than that of others. I think there is something here for everyone, young or old, adventurous or not. The service tends to be hit and miss but is typically decent.
I like California Pizza Kitchen a lot.  My favorite dish is the jambalaya.  Everyone I've taken to California Pizza Kitchen to try the jambalaya has liked it very much.

Highly under-rated. Me and my boyfriend come here thinking about just taking out, so we park in the take out area. We come in and change our minds after we see the beautiful presentations of the meals (and after contemplating the idea we don't have to clean up), I tell him we need to move the car and they say that its fine that we can leave the car there, we ordered the spinach flat-bread pizza which turned out delicious, I had an Italian Soda which our waiter kept bringing back cream and refills (and even a refill to go!) the service, the food, and the atmosphere were great, definitely coming back again, price was high but that is expected with the California pizza kitchens, and we had enough for the next day as well and it all came in boxes that were easily microwavable.

Great menu..fried mac n cheese & chicken wontons are yummy..love the grilled veggies salad!  Great service with positive attitude and superb attention for refills! Only bummer is they changed from Pepsi to Coke products in the last 2 weeks.

Service was horrible tonight. The server/kitchen messed up twice on our order and made us wait for about 20 additional minutes for our pizza.  Even with the long wait and messing up my order twice, I never got any kind of comp meal or dessert. Of course the food was good, but you can't enjoy a nice dinner when the service sucks...

I doubt that for most folks, CPK would qualify as comfort food but it is for me.  I've been a customer from its beginning in Los Angeles, when it was operating off the menu created by Ed LaDou (Wolfgang Puck's first pizza chef at the original Spago), and it still is a go-to for some of my favorites even though the chain has changed hands a couple of times.  CPK has a pretty disciplined training program so servers are generally skilled and attentive and you pretty much know what to expect in terms of atmosphere in that the restaurants all have a similar feel.  I've had favorite menu items come and go based on periodic menu changes, but the Sicilian and Thai Chicken pizzas always make me happy as does the original chopped salad (hold the scallions and the garbanzos, please).  The way the restaurants are set up, just about any size group can be accommodated and with the diverse and evolving menu choices, it's safe to say that there is something for everyone.  I always look forward to my next visit!

Service is wonderful, food was good. I ordered the chipotle chicken pizza and it was delicious. I don't think the pasta, linguine is up to par with the pizza, but still a good place to eat with a couple of friends or family. Environment friendly.

i was here with a gf the other day and i had a good time with her.    there are reasons that i give this place a 3 star and let me tell you why. decor:  of course just like any cpk, it always looks nice.  i like the dim lights so there is nothing wrong with this.  I like the rolling doors too, its fun to walk in and out because i felt like a kid again. food:  the food taste great.  we got a chipotle pizza and garlic cream fet. dish.  it was great.  so yummy.  i never thought garlic sauce would still taste good.  i didn't like how they would add 2 something dollars to split the pizza in half for different toppings.  how stupid is that!  its so easy to do but they charge you?  rip off. service:  i don't know what it is, but i actually didn't like my server.  i feel like he had an attitude toward us that i don't think its normal in most servers.  he actually annoyed me.  maybe he was tired from a whole day just like my friend said, but .... i just don't like his attitude.  its actually really rare for me to have that kind of vibe from restaurant workers.   price:  o... of course i don't like the price as much.  paying tip to a server i don't like is definately not cool.  cheap food but pay a lot for... always not my favorite thing to do. with the above reasons, i give this place a 3 star.  the more i think about it, it might even deserve a 2 star.  but because the food tasted good and they never rushed us to get out, i still give them a 3 star.

The food was wonderful and they had a large selection.  Some of the pizza choices are highly unusual and very tasty! The service was very nice both times we ate here, professional, friendly and very helpful.  The price was right considering the good quality of food and service.  The atmosphere was also very nice.  You could talk to your partner and did not have to yell, since the TV were on but the sound was off.  They also have a full bar.  Going back to try the other tempting pizzas soon.
The digital menu at all the table is incredible, and the ability to pay your bill with it, is an awesome time saver!!!
Less than avg. Pizza is unspectacular, pasta is heavy, and everything is just generally less than avg. I'd rather stay at home and order dominoes for a fraction of the price, or cook pasta myself.

I've only been in at this location a handful of times and can't understand why I can't seem to get myself here more often.  I like having the option of ordering half a salad and the pizzas are awesome.
The BUFFALO CHICKEN PIZZA was amazing! Service a little bit slow, but no biggie.

What has happened to CPK? They never had the best pizzas, pastas, or appetizers. But, at least their food was descent and delicious.  Today, I could only give their food a 2 star. The 3 stars was due to the attentive service.  Appetizers: Among the 7 or 8 appetizers, 3 of them were some kind of rolls which covered more than 1/3 of the appetizer choices. I thought the choices were pretty limited. I had the avocado rolls which were deep fried with some dry diced chicken, very salty bacon bits and tiny bit of avocado. My server recommended the lettuce wraps which again had some dry diced chicken with asian sauce, served with slices of lettuce. I did asked myself why didn't I go to a Chinese restaurant for this dish. Pasta: Jambalaya wasn't too bad, with enough ingredients(shrimp, sausage, ham, and crawfish) in it. Pizza: Hawaiian bbq chicken pizza tasted kinda weird. It's salty due to the bbq sauce but at the same time with a distinctive taste of sugar. The taste was off. The crust was not chewy or doughy. Even the whole pizza looked kinda sad, not appetizing at all.  Drinks: extremely disappointed with its new "Cranberry Cooler". For the first couple sip, I got chills down my spine due to its acidity.  Couple more sips, I found it tasteless. I was expecting this to be a refreshing drink, but it's almost like drinking slightly flavored water. Service: my server was efficient. The manager came to each table to socialize a bit. The atmosphere has always been pleasant. Very disappointed. Probably will not return any time soon.

The other night I went out, treated myself to a nice CPK dinner. The hostesses were idiots, and acted like they were 12. Not too impressed. The management seems like a joke, (tell you what you want to hear to your face, then when they go back to fix it, talk shit to the nearest server or assistant manager) but my server made up for it. He was a really friendly guy, wasn't too attentive that was annoying, but frequently checked on me, and it didn't feel like a sequence of service, or a list or required duties for him to get the job done. Mike was his name, and from what I could tell, he was running the bar, bar/lounge, my table, part of the patio, and what appeared to be a take out service. I know, sounds like he would be forgetting my bread, or bringing out the wrong drink, but he was surprisingly very collected. I had the chicken ceaser sandwhich on herb onion foccia bread, with the tortilla soup. All was pleasantly presented, and tasted great. To end of my trip to the HB location, I finished with a red velvet cake with a scoop of ice cream. There is a god. Thank you Mike, because of your great service, (and CPK doesnt strike my fancy) I will be coming back and of course, requesting you at the bar, lounge, patio, table, booth, OR take out!!!!!!!! ---- You have to get this server!!!!!!

This place is kind of hit or miss.  A couple times I've been here the pizza was bland and soggy, and the service was poor.  So I wasn't sure I wanted to go there tonight, but decided to give it a try.  I was pleasantly surprised.  The food was perfect and our waiter was great. Things I recommend: -- thai or baja spring roll appetizers -- thai chicken pizza -- thai crunch salad
